MasterClauseData.Effective_Date: As noted on the acceptance letter sent to you after you are enrolled.
MasterClauseData.TMS_Carve_Out: Payment for Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) Covered Services when billed with a 90867, 90868, or 90869 CPT® Code will be carved out of the Medicine – Behavioral Health in the table above and the pricing will be paid at 116% of 2021 CMS RBRVS.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provisions_of_Services_BlueCard_Prog: Blue Cross Blue Shield Out-of-Area Program (“BlueCard Program”).  Provider’s commitment to provide Covered Services to Members (see Section 4.1(a)) includes the commitment to provide Covered Services to Members of any BCBST Affiliate that has been licensed by BCBSA to use any of the BCBS Marks (“Out-of-Area Blue Members”).  Such Out-of-Area Blue Members may receive care pursuant to the BlueCard Program described in Section XIV of the Provider Manual.  Provider agrees to submit claims for payment related to such Out-of-Area Blue Members in accordance with Section XIV(I) of the Provider Manual and to accept, as the governing rate(s), the rates set forth in this Agreement and any applicable Network Attachment.

MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Service_Area_Section_4.2: Service Area. Provider's service area is as shown on the attached Exhibit B Home Infusion Therapy Service Area (“Exhibit B”).
MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Services_Section_4.1: Services. The specific home infusion therapy Covered Services provided by Provider are indicated in the attached Exhibit A - Home Infusion Therapy Services (“Exhibit A”).
MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Injectables_Drugs_Section_3.3_p3: Reimbursement for medications is limited to that amount actually prescribed and administered to the Member. Provider is responsible for using the most economical packaging of medication to achieve the required dosage for the Member with the least amount of medication wastage.

MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Injectables_Drugs_Section_3.3_p1: Injectable Drugs. Payment for injectable drugs related to home infusion therapy Covered Services is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Injectable_Drugs_Percent_of_Average_Sales_Price" Title="HITMA_Injectable_Drugs_Percent_of_Average_Sales_Price" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>106%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> percent of Average Sales Price (ASP) or, if there is no published ASP, a percentage of Wholesale Acquisition Cost (WAC) or Average Wholesale Price (AWP) as defined in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Total_Parenteral_Nutrition_Soluti: Total Parenteral Nutrition Solutions. Payment for total parenteral nutrition solutions Covered Services is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Total_Parenteral_Nutrition_Solutions_Percent_of_Medicare_Region_C_DMEPOS_Fee_Schedule" Title="HITMA_Total_Parenteral_Nutrition_Solutions_Percent_of_Medicare_Region_C_DMEPOS_Fee_Schedule" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Medicare Region C DMEPOS Fee Schedule for Tennessee (“DMEPOS Schedule”) published as of January 1 of each year. BCBST implements updates to the DMEPOS Schedule on April 1 of each year. Covered Services provided between January 1 and March 31 will be reimbursed based on the previous year's DMEPOS Schedule.
MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Home_Infusion_Therapy_Section_3.1: Notwithstanding the foregoing, when multiple services reimbursable at a per diem under this Attachment are provided on the same day, the primary therapy will be reimbursed at the lesser of billed charges or <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Primary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Primary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the per diem rate, the secondary therapy will be reimbursed at the lesser of billed charges or <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Secondary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Secondary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>50%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the per diem rate, and all subsequent therapies will be reimbursed at the lesser of billed charges or <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Subsequent_Therapies_Percent_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Subsequent_Therapies_Percent_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>25%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the per diem rate. All second and subsequent home infusion therapy Covered Services must be from separate infusion classes as defined in the Provider Manual.
This payment is all inclusive, including, without limitation, all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services.

Home Infusion Therapy. Payment for home infusion therapy Covered Services will be reimbursable at a per diem of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Home_Infusion_Therapy_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Home_Infusion_Therapy_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>$57.59<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>. Maintenance or infusion catheter care will be reimbursable at a per diem of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Maintenance_or_infusion_catheter_care_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Maintenance_or_infusion_catheter_care_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>$6.47<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>. Billing guidelines for these services are published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.HITPSL_PBM_Section_2.6: PBM. Provider is required to participate in the network of BCBST's pharmacy benefits manager so that services covered under certain Member's pharmacy benefits can be appropriately billed.
MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Warranties_Section_2.5: Warranties. Provider shall honor all product warranties, express or implied, for all supplies and equipment provided.
MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4: Use of Codes. The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual.If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
Reimbursement under this Attachment is limited to the services listed herein. Provider will only be reimbursed for days on which medications (drugs), total parenteral nutrition solutions, hydration solutions or infusion catheter care services are actually administered. Provider agrees that the billing of qualified drugs shall be limited to those administered for intravenous infusion. Drugs classified as oral or self-administered are excluded and will be denied under the terms of this Agreement.
Reimbursement Policies. In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.

MasterClauseData.HITPSL_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable. The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Maximum_Allowable" Title="HITMA_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>line level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. MasterClauseData.HITMA_Home_Infusion_Therapy_Section_3.1_: Notwithstanding the foregoing, when multiple Covered Services reimbursable at a per diem under this Attachment are provided on the same day, the primary therapy will be reimbursed at <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Primary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Primary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the per diem rate, the secondary therapy will be reimbursed at <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Secondary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Secondary_Therapy_Percent_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>50%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the per diem rate, and all subsequent therapies will be reimbursed at <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Subsequent_Therapies_Percent_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Same_Day_multiple_Services_Subsequent_Therapies_Percent_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>25%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the per diem rate. All second and subsequent home infusion therapy Covered Services must be from separate infusion classes as defined in the BCBST Provider Manual.
This payment is all-inclusive, including, without limitation, all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services.

Home Infusion Therapy.  Payment for home infusion therapy Covered Services will be reimbursable at a per diem of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HITMA_Home_Infusion_Therapy_Per_Diem" Title="HITMA_Home_Infusion_Therapy_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>$57.59<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>. This payment is all-inclusive, including, without limitation, all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services. Notwithstanding the foregoing, when multiple Covered Services reimbursable at a per diem under this Attachment are provided on the same day, the primary therapy will be reimbursed at 100% of the per diem rate, the secondary therapy will be reimbursed at 50% of the per diem rate, and all subsequent therapies will be reimbursed at 25% of the per diem rate. All second and subsequent home infusion therapy Covered Services must be from separate infusion classes as defined in the BCBST Provider Manual.

MasterClauseData.HHPDN_Revenue_Code_Section_1.5: “Revenue Code” means a hospital Revenue Code as adopted by CMS.
MasterClauseData.HHPDN_Per_Visit_Section_1.4: “Per Visit” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member on a one (1) calendar day period, for each type of service for which a Per Visit payment is indicated in this Attachment. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Visit payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member including, but not limited to, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay or an Outpatient Encounter, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and institution and ancillary services. Provider is required to identify each date of service when submitting claims that span multiple dates of service.
MasterClauseData.HHPDN_HCPCS_Code_Section_1.3: “HCPCS Code” means Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System based on the AMA’s Current Procedural Terminology (“CPT®”) and updated by CMS.
MasterClauseData.HHPDN_CPT_Code_Section_1.2: “CPT® Code” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”).  CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.HHPDN_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.

MasterClauseData.DME_Rentals_Section_3.3_p3: DME that is classified by CMS as a capped rental will be considered purchased after the equipment has been rented for a period of 10 months. If the Member changes to different but similar piece of equipment or DME (e.g. from a non-heated humidifier to a heated humidifier) when the equipment is medically needed (i.e. the Member's medical needs have substantially changed and the new equipment is necessary), a new 10-month rental period begins with the new equipment or DME. Otherwise, BCBST will reimburse the least expensive piece of equipment or DME (continuing to count against the current 10-month period). If the 10-month rental period has already expired, then no additional rental payments will be made.

MasterClauseData.DME_Generally_Section_3.1_a_i: is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="DME_Generally_Commercial_fee_schedule_Percentage" Title="DME_Generally_Commercial_fee_schedule_Percentage" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule, which is based on the current year Medicare DME MAC Jurisdiction C DMEPOS Fee Schedule for Tennessee under Original Medicare; or
DME that is classified by CMS as a capped rental will be considered purchased after the equipment has been rented for a period of 10 months. If the Member changes to different but similar piece of equipment or DME (e.g. from a non-heated humidifier to a heated humidifier) when the equipment is medically needed (i.e. the Member's medical needs have substantially changed and the new equipment is necessary), a new 10-month rental period begins with the new equipment or DME. Otherwise, BCBST will reimburse the least expensive piece of equipment or DME (continuing to count against the current 10-month period). If the 10-month rental period has already expired, then no additional rental payments will be made.
BCBST reserves the right to pay continuous rentals for as long as the Member continues to need the equipment in order to cover maintenance, service and use for DME that may require extensive service.

Rental rates are per month unless otherwise specified in the applicable billing guidelines outlined in the Provider Manual. BCBST reserves the right to prorate the established fee for partial month rentals. Rental rates include payment for repair, adjustment, maintenance and replacement of equipment and its components related to normal wear and tear, defects or obsolescence or aging.

Generally. Reimbursement for DME Covered Services as described in this Attachment constitutes full reimbursement for the item, including all labor charges involved in the assembly and support services, such as emergency services, delivery, set-up, education, and ongoing assistance with the item. Reimbursement for supplies used in conjunction with DME will be determined by the Medicare Region C DME Regional Carrier ("DMERC") guidelines.
MasterClauseData.DME_Warranties_Section_2.7: Warranties. Provider must honor all product warranties, express or implied, for all supplies and equipment provided.
MasterClauseData.DME_Use_Of_Codes_Section_2.6: Use of Codes. The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.DME_Rate_Updates_Section_2.5: Rate Updates. Rates under the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule are equivalent to amounts that would have been payable under Original Medicare to Provider for the same services; provided however, that BCBST updates its BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule in the timeframes described in the Provider Manual. No retroactive adjustments will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS's release of a rate and BCBST's implementation of such rate or due to CMS's retroactive implementation of an amended rate.
MasterClauseData.DME_Fee_Source_Section_2.4_p2: For CPT® Codes and HCPCS Codes without a published fee or methodology, reimbursement will be based on a reasonable allowable determined by BCBST, as described in the Provider Manual. Newly published CPT® Codes and HCPCS Codes will be added to the DMEPOS Schedule with the effective date of the applicable CPT® Code or HCPCS Code. If CMS establishes multiple payment amounts for a new code, the highest CMS rate will be added and locked based on the contract percentage and the first published Medicare fee. If CMS establishes a single payment amount for a new code, the new code will be added with the rate locked at 100% of the first published Medicare fee.
MasterClauseData.DME_Fee_Source_Section_2.4_p1: Fee source. Fee amounts set forth in this Attachment are based on the Medicare Region C DMEPOS Fee Schedule for Tennessee as of July 1, 2015 (the "DMEPOS Schedule")
MasterClauseData.DME_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3ma: Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program. Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services.
Reimbursement Policies. In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.DME_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_p: BCBST will not reimburse Provider for DME that should have been billed by another provider type (e.g., an acute care facility).
Reimbursement Policies. In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.DME_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements. All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a CMS 1500 form or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.DME_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable. The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the line level as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.

MasterClauseData.CAC_Separately_Reimbursed_Drug_Fee_Sched: The Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule will be updated in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for the BCBST Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule contained in the Provider Manual.
Drug codes submitted for consideration, but not shown on the Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule are not eligible for payment and will be denied as non-contracted.

Drugs shown on the Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule and associated with Not Otherwise Classified (“NOC”) or Unlisted/Miscellaneous/Non-Specific HCPCS Codes or with no established fee shown will be manually priced in accordance with BCBST’s policy for Unlisted, Miscellaneous, Non-Specific and Not Otherwise Classified Procedures/Services, but may not be eligible for payment.  Such drugs must be billed with a unit of one (1) and require submission of: (i) drug name; (ii) National Drug Code (“NDC”) in field 43 “Revenue Description/ IDE/ Medicaid Drug Rebate” on the CMS-1450 claim form; and (iii) dosage administered. Failure to submit this information will result in delay of reimbursement.

Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule.  BCBST will reimburse acute care hospitals for outpatient drugs listed in the Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule, in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for BCBST Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule contained in the Provider Manual. Eligible drugs will be reimbursed in addition to other outpatient services filed on the CMS-1450 (UB-04 or successor) claim form.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Payment_Hierarchy_Section_4.5_e: Payment Hierarchy.  BCBST will adhere to the following payment hierarchy for Outpatient Covered Services: (1) Outpatient Surgery procedures (2) all other. Except as otherwise set forth in this Attachment, BCBST will pay only the highest service in the hierarchy. All other services are considered included in the highest ranked service.
MasterClauseData.CAC_All_Other_Outpatient_Services_Sectio: All Other Outpatient Services.  All other Outpatient Services are those services that cannot otherwise be appropriately categorized for reimbursement in this Schedule 2 and that are approved for reimbursement by BCBST. The Revenue Codes listed in the Outpatient Payment Category Table will be considered for reimbursement unless performed in connection with an all-inclusive service.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Emergency_Services_Section_4.5_c: Emergency Services.  In instances where a Member is admitted into an inpatient setting after treatment in the emergency room within 72 hours for related conditions, separate payment will not be made for the Emergency Services, and payment for the Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Rate Table will also represent payment for the Emergency Services.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Laboratory_and_Radiology_Services_Se: Laboratory and Radiology Services.  The fee schedules (2-B, 2-C, 2-D) referenced in this section are derived from the technical component of the Medicare RBRVS and the Medicare Clinical Laboratory Fee Schedule in effect as of January 1, 2019. Updates and deletions of codes will be in accordance with BCBST policies and procedures related to the addition/deletion of CPT® Codes as found in the Provider Manual. Codes in these categories that are not listed on the fee schedules are considered not contracted and are not reimbursable.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Observation_Services_Section_4.5_a: Observation Services.  Provider must obtain Prior Authorization in order to receive payment for Observation Services. In instances where a Member is admitted into an inpatient setting from observation status within 72 hours for related conditions, separate payment will not be made for the Observation Services, and payment for the Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Rate Table will also represent payment for the Observation Services.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Outpatient_Surgery_Procedures_Sectio: When multiple surgical procedures are performed on the same day, the payment for the first procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CAC_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Title="CAC_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #><# <Conditional Test="//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Provider_Specialty[text()='Critical Access']" /> #>100%<# <EndConditional/> #><# <Conditional Test="not(//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Provider_Specialty[text()='Critical Access'])" /> #>100%<# <EndConditional/> #><# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment, the payment for the second procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CAC_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Title="CAC_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #><# <Conditional Test="//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Provider_Specialty[text()='Critical Access']" /> #>50%<# <EndConditional/> #><# <Conditional Test="not(//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Provider_Specialty[text()='Critical Access'])" /> #>50%<# <EndConditional/> #><# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment and the payment for the third procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CAC_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Title="CAC_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #><# <Conditional Test="//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Provider_Specialty[text()='Critical Access']" /> #>0%<# <EndConditional/> #><# <Conditional Test="not(//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Provider_Specialty[text()='Critical Access'])" /> #>25%<# <EndConditional/> #><# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment. No additional payments will be made for procedures beyond the third procedure. When a procedure is repeated on the same day there will be no additional payment for the second procedure. Bilateral procedures will be paid in accordance with the Provider Manual.

Surgical Covered Services that are paid with the Outpatient Surgery Groups but that have not yet been assigned an Outpatient Surgery Group will appear on the Attachment 2-A and pay at the “Unlisted” rate until the annual recalibration process referenced in the Billing and Reimbursement Section of the Provider Manual, at which time the code will be moved to the appropriate Outpatient Surgery Group. These new assignments will automatically be made a part of Attachment 2-A, without any formal amendments thereto.

Outpatient Surgery Procedures.  Surgical Covered Services provided during an Outpatient Encounter will use the Per Case Payment Methodology. Surgical procedures will be paid according to the Outpatient Surgery Group to which BCBST assigns the procedure contained in Attachment 2-A.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Exclusions_Section_4.2_p2: Any items or services provided to Non-Patient Members
MasterClauseData.CAC_Exclusions_Section_4.2_p1: Exclusions.  The following are specifically excluded from payment under this Attachment:
MasterClauseData.CAC_Covered_Services_for_Outpatient_Sect: Covered Services for Outpatient. Outpatient Covered Services must be filed with the appropriate Revenue Code and/or CPT® Code /HCPCS Code on the institutional claim in order to be considered for payment.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Exclusions_Section_3.3_p2: Any Inpatient Covered Services not listed in Schedule 1.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Exclusions_Section_3.3_p1: Exclusions.  The following are specifically excluded from payment under this Attachment:
MasterClauseData.CAC_Impatient_Rehabilitation_Section_3.2: Inpatient Rehabilitation.  Inpatient Rehabilitation must be billed separate from other services in the Inpatient Payment Category Table.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Other_Payment_Policies_Section_3.2_e: Other Payment Policies.  For information on BCBST's payment policies refer to the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Against_Medical_Advice_Discharges_Se: Against Medical Advice Discharges.  Inpatient Stays during which the Member left the Provider against medical advice will be reimbursable as referenced in the Inpatient Stay Payment Category Table or an Outlier payment, whichever is applicable.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Expired_Patients_Section_3.2_c: Expired Patients.  An Inpatient Stay during which the Member expires will be treated as a normal discharge and reimbursable as referenced in the Inpatient Stay Payment Category Table or an Outlier payment, whichever is applicable.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Ambulance_Services_Section_3.2_b: Ambulance Services.  Appropriate hospital-based ambulance services provided prior to an Inpatient Stay will be paid in addition to the applicable Payment Rate set forth in the Inpatient Payment Category Table and should be billed by the Provider as an outpatient service. Ambulance charges incurred while the patient is an inpatient are included in the applicable Payment Rate regardless of whether the ambulance provider is owned/operated by Provider or an Affiliate or an independent ambulance contractor. In instances where the ambulance provider is an independent ambulance contractor, ambulance services will be considered Covered Services furnished under arrangement.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Transfer_Payments_Section_3.2_a: Transfer Payments.  Transfers are considered normal admissions for the Receiving Hospital and are reimbursable as an Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Receiving Hospital's contract. The Transferring Hospital will receive the Transfer Per Diem in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Category Table above.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Covered_Services_for_Inpatient_Secti: Covered Services for Inpatient.  Covered Services provided to a Member during an Inpatient Stay are payable as described in the Inpatient Payment Category Table. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, the Payment Rate for an Inpatient Stay is the Payment Rate in effect on the date the Inpatient Stay begins.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Escalators_Section_2.8: Escalator(s).  Escalators are applied to only fixed rates. Exclusions from the escalators include transfer per diems, outliers, rates paid at a percentage of charge, rates paid at a percentage of Medicare, or rates paid at a percentage of a fee schedule.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Critical_Access_Hospital_Designation: Critical Access Hospital Designation.  Designation by CMS as a critical access hospital is a BCBST standard for participating in this Agreement. Provider must notify BCBST immediately in the event it loses or is likely to lose its CMS designation as a critical access hospital. Losing designation as a critical access hospital will be considered a material breach of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Audit_Section_2.6: Audit.  BCBST may recover from Provider any amounts identified during an audit, pursuant to BCBSTs standard audit policy.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Chargemaster_Protection_Section_2.5: Chargemaster Protection.  For those services paid at a POC, BCBST acknowledges that Provider may increase the charge values within its Chargemaster. Provider must provide BCBST with written notice of any changes to its Chargemaster sixty (60) days prior to the effective date of such change(s). BCBST may, as appropriate, make adjustments to POC Payments to ensure the overall payment remains equivalent to the payments prior to the increase. BCBST will provide written notification to Provider of the adjustment to the rates paid at POC, and such adjustment will take effect in accordance with the written notification without a formal amendment to the Attachment. Without limiting any other audit rights of BCBST, BCBST has the right to audit Provider's records to assure compliance with this provision.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4: Use of Codes.  The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CAC_Billing_Requirements" Title="CAC_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>CMS 1450 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CAC_Maximum_Allowable" Title="CAC_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>claim level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.CAC_DEFINITIONS_Section_1: The following terms are defined for the purposes of this Attachment. All other capitalized terms have the same meaning as in the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Per_Case_Section_1.9: “Per Case” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member during an Inpatient Stay or an Outpatient Encounter. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Case payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member including, but not limited to, Implants, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay or an Outpatient Encounter, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and room and board.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Payments_Rates_Section_1.8: “Payment Rate(s)” means Maximum Allowable as defined in the Billing and Reimbursement Guidelines section below.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Payment_Methodology_Section_1.7: “Payment Methodology” means a methodology for determining Payment Rates in this attachment.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Outpatient_Surgery_Group_Section_1.6: “Outpatient Surgery Group” means the group to which an outpatient surgical procedure code is assigned based on expected use of resources. This does not include any outpatient surgical procedures specifically carved out in this attachment.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Implants_Section_1.5: “Implant(s)” means a Surgical Implant or a Surgical Appliance.
MasterClauseData.CAC_HCPCS_Code_Section_1.4: “HCPCS Code” means Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System based on the AMA’s Current Procedural Terminology (“CPT®”) and updated by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CAC_CPT_Codes_Section_1.3: “CPT® Code(s)” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.CAC_CMS_Section_1.2: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Transferring_Hospital_Section_1.18: “Transferring Hospital” means the hospital that initially admits and subsequently transfers a Member to a Receiving Hospital.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Transfers_Section_1.17: “Transfer(s)” means instances in which a Member is transferred from a Transferring Hospital to a Receiving Hospital for treatment.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Surgical_Implants_Section_1.16: “Surgical Implant” means a device that is Medically Necessary that is surgically placed internally for therapeutic or reconstructive purposes and not considered a prosthetic or orthotic device.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Surgical_Appliance_Section_1.15: “Surgical Appliance” means a surgical device that is Medically Necessary that is externally placed as a part of a surgical procedure and is integral to the surgical procedure and not considered a prosthetic or orthotic device.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Revenue_Codes_Section_1.14: “Revenue Code(s)” means a hospital Revenue Code as adopted by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Receiving_Hospital_Section_1.13: “Receiving Hospital” means the hospital that receives a Member from a Transferring Hospital.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Percent_of_Charge_Payments_Section_1: “Percent of Charge Payment(s)” (“POC”) means the percentage applied to the Provider's detail line item covered charge to determine the payment rates for those services for which the payment rate is calculated as a percentage of covered charges.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Per_Unit_Section_1.11: “Per Unit” means a Payment Methodology based on CPT® Code/HCPCS Code in the applicable fee schedules for each unit of service. Provider must bill the appropriate Revenue Code and CPT® Code/HCPCS Code to receive payment.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Per_Diems_Section_1.10: “Per Diem(s)” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member for each day of an Inpatient Stay. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Diem payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member during each day of an Inpatient Stay including, but not limited to, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non- diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and room and board.
MasterClauseData.CAC_Chargemaster_Section_1.1: “Chargemaster” means Provider's comprehensive listing of items and services billable by Provider and Provider's associated charges for such items and services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Confidentiality_Section_9.5: Confidentiality.  Each Party, its Affiliates, and its and their respective officers, directors, and employees will hold all information received or disclosed pursuant to this Agreement in strict confidence and in accordance with applicable state and federal law. The Parties agree not to reveal financial or other terms and conditions of this Agreement to any other Person or entity, except as required by law, required by a valid court order, or mutually agreed to in a writing executed by both Parties. Further, and notwithstanding the confidentiality provisions in this section, Provider authorizes BCBST to collect, compile, compare, and disseminate information concerning, without limitation, Provider's utilization of services, fees or charges, compliance with requirements for Utilization Management and Quality Improvement Programs, BCBST Member satisfaction results, and performance within the industry. BCBST may disseminate such information to Provider, other Network Providers, Payors, customers and potential customers, BCBST Members, and regulatory or accreditation agencies, provided that, in the event that BCBST provides such information directly to another Network Provider of the same type as Provider, the information provided will not identify Provider unless Provider has consented in writing. This provision will survive termination or expiration of this Agreement for any reason.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Availability_of_Records_Section_9.4: Availability of Records.  Subject to all applicable privacy and confidentiality requirements as required by law, the medical records of Members will be made available in a timely manner to Healthcare Professionals treating Members, and to BCBST, its agents and representatives, at no charge to BCBST or to Members. In the event that a Member is transferred from Provider, dis-enrolls from his or her Blue Cross Benefit Plan, or Provider no longer participates in the Member's Network, Provider will, upon Member's request and at no cost, provide a copy of such Member's medical records to BCBST, the Member and the attending Physician in a timely manner, as appropriate for the efficient provision of care to such Member.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Compliance_with_42_C.F.R._Part_2_Par: Compliance with 42 C.F.R. Part 2 (Part 2).  If BCBST does not receive patient-identifying information that is protected by Part 2 (“Part 2 Information”), the obligations in this Section will not apply. To the extent that in performing an audit or evaluation for purposes of this Agreement, BCBST receives, stores, uses, processes, discloses, maintains, transmits or otherwise deals with Part 2 Information, BCBST acknowledges and agrees to: (1) retain records in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local record retention laws; (2) maintain and destroy Part 2 Information in a manner consistent with the policies and procedures established under 42 C.F.R. § 2.16; (3) only use Part 2 Information to carry out an audit or evaluation purpose or to investigate or prosecute criminal or other activities, as authorized by a court order entered under 42 C.F.R. § 2.66; and (4) only disclose Part 2 Information as permitted under Part 2, including to Provider.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Audits_and_Inspections_of_Records_Se: Audits and Inspections of Records.  Provider agrees that BCBST, or a representative designated by BCBST, is allowed to perform audits and inspections of records related to the performance of services under this Agreement, including but not limited to financial and medical records, and Utilization Management and Quality Improvement Programs covering the provision of services to any Member, pursuant to the guidelines as set forth in the Provider Manual. Such audits and inspections will be permitted without charge to BCBST or its designated representative, who will be provided copies of records involving the audit or inspection without charge. Except in the event of suspected fraud, waste and abuse, or other illegal activity, such inspection, audit and duplication will occur only after reasonable notice and during regular working hours. Provider will use its best efforts to furnish records requested by BCBST promptly and in an electronic format. Audits and inspections are conducted as part of BCBST's healthcare operations in accordance with applicable federal law.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Maintenance_of_Records_Section_9.2: Maintenance of Records.  Provider will prepare and maintain all appropriate records on Members receiving services. The records will be maintained (i) in accordance with prudent record-keeping procedures , (ii) in a form and manner as described in the Provider Manual, and (iii) as required by law. Notwithstanding the foregoing, BCBST is not defining or prescribing the medical and clinical information and content of the records, so long as such records comply with applicable law.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Processing_of_Claims_Section_9.1: Processing of Claims.  Provider will furnish to BCBST, without charge, all information reasonably required by BCBST for the proper processing and adjudication of claims, including complete and accurate descriptions of the services performed and charges made. Provider will furnish such data in an electronic format and provide all encounter data as requested by BCBST.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Use_of_BCBSTs_Name_Section_8.3: Use of BCBST's Name.  Provider will not use BCBST's name, symbols, trademarks, or service marks in advertising or promotional materials, or in any other way, without the prior written consent of BCBST and will cease any such permitted usage immediately upon Notice from BCBST to do so, or upon termination of this Agreement, whichever occurs first.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provider_Information_Section_8.2: Provider Information.  BCBST will be permitted to collect, compile, compare, and disseminate information regarding Provider pursuant to, and in accordance with, Tennessee law.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Use_of_Providers_Name_Section_8.1: Use of Provider's Name.  BCBST will have the right to use the name of Provider for purposes of informing Members of the identity of Provider through written (e.g., directories) or oral means, and otherwise to carry out the terms of the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Disputes_Section_7.1: Disputes.  Provider acknowledges and agrees to abide by the Dispute Resolution Process, including the mandatory arbitration requirement, set forth in the Provider Manual. Unless specified in the Provider Manual, Provider agrees that the Dispute Resolution Process is the exclusive method for addressing or resolving any and all controversies, disputes, or claims between Provider and BCBST and its Affiliates. Provider further agrees that BCBST may amend the Dispute Resolution Process from time to time by providing <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_DisputeResolutionNotice" Title="CPA_DisputeResolutionNotice" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true" /> #>thirty (30) days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> prior written notice in advance of the changes becoming effective. The Dispute Resolution Process is incorporated by reference into this Agreement and shall survive the termination of this Agreement. Entities shall not have a right to independently bring a claim relating to a dispute under this Agreement; rather, Provider must bring any claim on behalf of Entities.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Quality_Improvement_and_Utilization_: Quality Improvement and Utilization Management Programs.  BCBST, or an entity designated by BCBST, will maintain Quality Improvement Programs and Utilization Management Programs and will monitor the delivery of healthcare services to Members. For the purposes of providing Covered Services to Members, Provider agrees to comply with BCBST's Quality Improvement Programs and Utilization Management Programs. BCBST may monitor Provider's quality improvement activities and compliance with Quality Improvement Programs and Utilization Management Programs.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Additional_Obligations_of_Provider_S: Additional Obligations of Provider.  Provider agrees to notify BCBST promptly, but no later than <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_SubrogationNotificationDays" Title="CPA_SubrogationNotificationDays" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> after treatment, if it renders Covered Services to a Member to treat an illness or injury that may have been caused by the Member or by a third party. Further, Provider agrees to cooperate with BCBST and to provide any information, documentation, and assistance reasonably requested to permit BCBST to protect and enforce its rights under this section.
Provider's Obligation.  Provider acknowledges and agrees that it will have no right of subrogation or recovery from the Member or a third party for Covered Services rendered to a Member pursuant to this Agreement. Payment of the applicable Maximum Allowable will be payment in full for such Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_BCBSTs_Right_to_Subrogation_and_Reco: BCBST's Right to Subrogation and Recovery.  Provider acknowledges and agrees that BCBST will be subrogated to and have the right to recover amounts paid for Covered Services whenever a Member receives such Covered Services to treat illnesses or injuries caused by the Member or a third party. In such circumstances, BCBST will have the right to recover amounts paid for Covered Services for the Member's illness or injury on a first-dollar basis, regardless of whether the Member has been made whole for his or her injuries. Provider agrees that BCBST's right to reimbursement or subrogation are net of reasonable costs and attorney's fees, such costs and fees not to exceed <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_SubrogationCosts" Title="CPA_SubrogationCosts" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the gross amount owed to BCBST.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Maintenance_of_Benefits_Section_5.8: Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits.  When a Member is eligible for benefits under more than one health insurance program, policy, or other form of governmental or non-governmental health insurance coverage, the determination of primary and secondary liability (“Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits”) will be made in accordance with applicable rules and established guidelines. Provider will make a good faith effort to determine if a Member is eligible for Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits. If Provider becomes aware of the availability of other health insurance coverage, it will promptly notify BCBST of that fact. Provider may seek payment for the provision of services rendered by Provider from multiple health benefit plans when a Member is eligible to receive benefits from other health insurers. If BCBST is the secondary Payor, then BCBST will coordinate with the primary insurance carrier or Payor and pay up to the Maximum Allowable or will pay as set forth in the Member's Blue Cross Benefit Plan. When Provider seeks payment from another insurer, Provider is not obligated to seek payment from such insurer based on the rates in the applicable Network Attachment. BCBST and Provider will cooperate and exchange information regarding alternative health coverage of Members and other information relative to Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits.
Pass-Through Charges Exception.  For an Inpatient Stay or where otherwise permitted by BCBST in writing, if Provider provides services under arrangement with another healthcare provider, Provider is permitted to submit claims to BCBST or charges to a Member for those services. BCBST and the Member shall have no liability to that other healthcare provider, and Provider shall be financially liable to the other healthcare provider for those services. Provider shall advise the other healthcare provider of Provider's responsibility to pay for such services and shall not permit the other healthcare provider to bill, charge or otherwise attempt to collect from BCBST, the Member or any third party for the services. In the event that BCBST pays the other healthcare provider for such services, BCBST shall have the right to recover the amount of such payment from Provider or withhold future payments from Provider equaling the amount of the payment to the other healthcare provider as set forth in the “Overpayments and Underpayments” provision in this Agreement. Any obligation by BCBST to make payment for services is further subject to the additional terms of this Agreement, the Provider Manual, and the Member's underlying Blue Cross Benefit Plan.

Pass-Through Charges Exception.  Unless otherwise permitted by BCBST in writing, if Provider provides services under arrangement with another healthcare provider, Provider is permitted to submit claims to BCBST or charges to a Member for those services. BCBST and the Member shall have no liability to that other healthcare provider, and Provider shall be financially liable to the other healthcare provider for those services. Provider shall advise the other healthcare provider of Provider's responsibility to pay for such services and shall not permit the other healthcare provider to bill, charge or otherwise attempt to collect from BCBST, the Member or any third party for the services. In the event that BCBST pays the other healthcare provider for such services, BCBST shall have the right to recover the amount of such payment from Provider or withhold future payments from Provider equaling the amount of the payment to the other healthcare provider as set forth in the “Overpayments and Underpayments” provision in this Agreement. Any obligation by BCBST to make payment for services is further subject to the additional terms of this Agreement, the Provider Manual, and the Member's underlying Blue Cross Benefit Plan.
MasterClauseData.CPA_General_Rule_Section_5.7.a_prov: General Rule.  Provider is not permitted to submit claims to BCBST for services performed, in whole or in part, by another provider unless permitted by BCBST in writing or the services are performed as part of an Inpatient Stay.
MasterClauseData.CPA_General_Rule_Section_5.7.a_prof: General Rule.  Provider is not permitted to submit claims to BCBST for services performed, in whole or in part, by another provider unless permitted by BCBST in writing.
MasterClauseData.CPA_NonPatient_Member_Services_Section_5: Non-Patient Member Services.  Provider shall not be eligible for payment under this Agreement for any items or services provided to Non-Patient Members. In order to be eligible for payment for services provided to Non-Patient Members, Provider must enter into a separate agreement with BCBST that applies to services for Non-Patient Members or receive prior written approval from BCBST to bill for such services under this Agreement. Items and services provided to Non-Patient Members are Non-Reimbursable Services under this Agreement, so Provider may not charge, collect a deposit from, seek compensation from, or have any recourse against Members for Non-Patient Member items or services under this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Administrative_Clinical_and_Support_: Administrative, Clinical, and Support Services.  Provider agrees to provide all administrative, clinical and support services necessary to deliver the services it is licensed, credentialed and qualified to provide. Provider also agrees that it will not engage in the unbundling of such services or permit other providers to bill for such administrative, clinical and support services.
Submission Requirements.  Provider warrants that all charges submitted for Covered Services are legitimate. Provider agrees to submit all charges for services to BCBST for adjudication in accordance with the applicable Provider Manual. Provider will submit charges for Covered Services on Clean Claims within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_SubmissionOfChargesRenderedServicePeriod" Title="CPA_SubmissionOfChargesRenderedServicePeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>6 months<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> from the date Covered Services have been rendered to the Member or, for facilities, within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_SubmissionOfChargesRenderedServicePeriod" Title="CPA_SubmissionOfChargesRenderedServicePeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>6 months<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> from the date of discharge of the Member. If BCBST is the secondary Payor to another commercial insurer or Medicare, claims must be submitted within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_SubmissionsOfChargesSecondPayorPeriod" Title="CPA_SubmissionsOfChargesSecondPayorPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>60 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> from the date indicated on the primary insurer's remittance advice or explanation of benefits. Failure to submit claims within the proper time period will result in denial of claims. Provider agrees to abide by recognized standards of coding, as determined by BCBST, and will not engage in any unbundling, upcoding or any similar activities. In addition, BCBST will have the authority, where BCBST determines that such activity has occurred, to rebundle, down code and otherwise address and correct such activities.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Review_of_Records_Section_5.4.e: Review of Records.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, BCBST's review of relevant financial and/or medical records will not be limited to such 18-month time period, nor will BCBST be prohibited from pursuing any other remedy available either at law or in equity
MasterClauseData.CPA_Payment_Correction_Section_5.4.d: Payment Correction.  Provider agrees that BCBST will not be required to correct a payment error to Provider if the request for payment correction is made more than 18 months from the date Provider received payment or notice of non-payment for the specific claim in issue.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Recoupment_Limitations_Section_5.4.c: Recoupment Limitations.  For all Networks, other than those requiring a longer period by regulation or statute, BCBST's request for recoupments will be made no later than 18 months after the date that BCBST paid the claim submitted by Provider that has been paid in error, except in the case of Provider's fraud, in which case no time limit will apply.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Overpayment_Recovery_Section_5.4.b: Overpayment Recovery.  If BCBST determines, in its sole discretion, that it has made an overpayment to Provider, Provider is obligated to and agrees to reimburse BCBST for such overpayment, subject to Provider's right to appeal in accordance with the procedures set forth in this Agreement and the Provider Manual. BCBST may recover the amount of such overpayment by offsetting the overpayment against what is owed or may become due to Provider for other claims, or at its discretion, BCBST may permit direct repayment of the overpayment by Provider.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Overpayments_and_Underpayments_Secti: Overpayments and Underpayments.  Claim payments made by BCBST are contingent upon the accuracy of diagnostic and other information provided by Provider to BCBST. If BCBST determines that it has made erroneous overpayments or underpayments to Provider, BCBST may recover or make additional payments to correct such errors. Reasons for overpayments include, without limitation, payments made for Non-Covered Services or Non-Reimbursable Services, duplicate payments, payment made for services rendered to ineligible individuals, payments made as the primary Payor when BCBST should be the secondary Payor, or payments for bundled or Non-Reimbursable Services in accordance with BCBST's claim coding protocols, as specified in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Deduction_of_Certain_Payments_Sectio: Deduction of Certain Payments.  BCBST will have the right to deduct any Member Cost Sharing Obligations from payments due Provider. Deductions for the Member Cost Sharing Obligations will be determined on the basis of the applicable contracted reimbursement amounts, as set forth in applicable Network Attachments.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Member_Cost_Sharing_Obligation_Secti: Member Cost Sharing Obligation.  Provider will not waive any applicable Member Obligation without BCBST's prior written approval. Provider must bill and make a good faith effort to collect all applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations from Members as a condition to receiving reimbursement from BCBST for Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Payment_Dispute_Resolution_Section_5: Payment Dispute Resolution.  Both Parties agree that it is the intent of this Agreement that all payments and dispute resolutions will be resolved pursuant to the terms of this Agreement and the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Administrative_Services_Section_5.1_: Administrative Services.  If a Payor that has contracted with BCBST to perform administrative services for a group is responsible for reimbursing Provider for services rendered to Members covered by that Payor, BCBST's obligation pursuant to the “Reimbursement” provision in this Agreement will be limited to making a good faith effort to arrange to have the responsible Payor reimburse Provider for such services. Such services will be deemed to be Non-Covered Services if the responsible Payor fails to reimburse Provider for otherwise Covered Services and BCBST shall have no financial liability or payment obligation to Provider for such services.
MasterClauseData.UCA_Urgent_Care_Services_Section_3.1p1: Urgent Care Services. Payment for Urgent Care Covered Services is the all-inclusive case rate(s) set out below:
Ineligible Member.  Notwithstanding Provider's agreement to not seek compensation from a Member for Covered Services, if a Member is subsequently determined to have been ineligible at the time Covered Services were rendered, BCBST will recover payments made to Provider for Covered Services in accordance with the terms of the Provider Manual.
Member Hold Harmless.  Provider agrees that in no event, including, but not limited to, non-payment by BCBST including non-payment as a result of Provider's failure to submit claims in accordance with the “Submission of Charges”  provision in this Agreement, rebundling or downcoding of charges by BCBST as described in the “Submission of Charges” provision in this Agreement, or breach of this Agreement, will Provider bill, charge, collect a deposit from, seek compensation from, or have any recourse against Members for Covered Services provided pursuant to this Agreement. This provision will not prevent Provider from charging Members for applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations or for Non-Covered Services in accordance with the “Reimbursement” provision in this Agreement. Provider agrees that it will not seek payment from a Member for a Non-Reimbursable Service.
MasterClauseData.UCA_Urgent_Care_Services_Section_3.1p2: Case rates identified above are all-inclusive, including without limitation all facility/technical, professional and/or ancillary services, equipment, and/or supplies provided during or as a part of an urgent care visit and/or used in conjunction with the Urgent Care Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Non_Covered_Services_or_Not_Medicall: Non-Covered Services or Not Medically Necessary.  BCBST is not obligated to pay for services provided by Provider that are not Medically Necessary (including Investigational services) or that are Non-Covered Services. However, the Parties recognize that Members might request services that are not Medically Necessary or are Non-Covered Services. Provider may bill the Member for such services, but only if, prior to performing such services, Provider notifies the Member in writing that the services will not be Covered Services and obtains the Member's informed, written consent in the form of a procedure-specific financial responsibility agreement requiring the Member to acknowledge his or her payment responsibility for such services. Any such procedure-specific acknowledgment of financial responsibility must be the same or substantially similar to the form provided in the applicable Provider Manual and must contain the terms provided for therein.
MasterClauseData.UCA_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.6: Use of Codes. The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
Maximum Allowable.  Payment to Provider of the Maximum Allowable, less Member Cost Sharing Obligations, for Covered Services rendered to a Member will constitute payment in full for such Covered Services. Provider agrees to accept 98% of billed charges as a payment in full for services rendered to Members not enrolled in a Network. Provider will not bill any Member for any difference between the Maximum Allowable Covered Service and Provider's billed charges for such Covered Service.
MasterClauseData.UCA_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.5_p: Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program. Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services.
Reimbursement Policies. In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
EFT and Payment.  BCBST agrees to pay Provider, via Electronic Funds Transfer (“EFT”), for Covered Services in accordance with (i) state or federal laws or regulations applicable to the Blue Cross Benefit Plan covering the Member receiving Covered Services from Provider, (ii) the terms of this Agreement, and (iii) the terms of the applicable Network Attachment. BCBST will process all Clean Claims submitted to BCBST. In the event Provider is unable to receive payment via EFT, BCBST may, in its discretion, terminate this Agreement in accordance with “BCBST Immediate Termination” provision in this Agreement.

Notice at Recredentialing. Provider shall notify BCBST at the time of recredentialing of all final determinations of any action or lawsuit brought against Provider relating to a quality of care complaint.

MasterClauseData.UCA_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the claim level, as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Provider_Network_Participation_Confi: Provider Network Participation Confirmation.  Provider agrees that it will not represent itself as a Network Provider until it has received written confirmation from BCBST that Provider is a Network Provider.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Eligibility_Requirements_Section_4.7: Eligibility Requirements.  Provider acknowledges and agrees that each Healthcare Professional with staff privileges at Provider must be credentialed at all times throughout the Term of this Agreement, and must maintain all credentialing requirements in accordance with Provider's policies and procedures. Furthermore, Provider shall ensure that each Healthcare Professional who provides Covered Services to Members at Provider shall be credentialed to be a BCBST provider, to the extent BCBST requires credentialing of Healthcare Professionals of that type, in accordance with the applicable Provider Manual. Provider shall routinely monitor said Healthcare Professionals to ensure adherence to applicable Provider and Provider Manual requirements.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Eligibility_Requirements_Section_4.7: Eligibility Requirements.  Provider acknowledges and agrees that each of its Associated Providers who is subject to credentialing requirements (i.e., physicians, physician assistants and nurse practitioners) must be credentialed to provide services as a BCBST provider at all times throughout the Term of this Agreement, and must maintain all credentialing requirements in accordance with the applicable Provider Manual. Provider shall routinely monitor said Associated Providers to ensure adherence to applicable Provider and Provider Manual rules.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Insurance_Requirements_Section_4.6_a: Requirements.  BCBST will maintain such insurance coverage that BCBST reasonably believes to be appropriate. Provider will maintain general liability and professional liability insurance coverages, in accordance with BCBST's credentialing and re-credentialing requirements and Network Participation Criteria, as specified in the Provider Manual. Provider's insurance coverage will provide coverage against claims for damages caused, in whole or in part, by any act or omission by Provider, and Provider's other employees, agents, or Affiliates. Provider will provide evidence of any of the aforementioned insurance coverage to BCBST upon BCBST's request, and will inform BCBST immediately of any change in such coverage.

Any additions to the table will require a written amendment signed by the Parties.
MasterClauseData.CPA_License_Requirement_Section_4.5: License Requirement.  Provider represents to BCBST that Provider possesses and will maintain all published certificates and licenses required by BCBST and state and federal law to perform its obligations pursuant to this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.UCH_Escalator_Section_2.6: Escalator.  Provider will receive a one-time 3% increase on the Rate listed in the table below on the one-year (first) Anniversary Date of the Agreement. Any additional escalator in subsequent years will require an amendment signed by the parties.
MasterClauseData.UCH_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.5: Use of Codes.  The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Exclusivity_Section_4.4: Exclusivity.  This Agreement is not intended, and will not be construed, to grant Provider an exclusive or preferential right to provide Covered Services to Members, except as expressly provided in this Agreement or a Network Attachment. Provider acknowledges that BCBST may enter into arrangements with other providers to render specified Covered Services to Members on an exclusive or preferential basis. In such circumstances, Provider will refer Members to such providers to receive those Covered Services in accordance with the applicable Quality Improvement Program and Utilization Management Program requirements.
MasterClauseData.UCH_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4: Rate Updates.  BCBST shall only pay for urgent care at home Covered Services when billed with the appropriate CPT® Code as listed herein or described in the Provider Manual. If any CPT® Code used herein is replaced or altered by the AMA, this Attachment automatically shall incorporate such replacement or alteration, without the need for formal amendment of this Attachment or the Provider Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Prior_Authorization_Section_4.3: Prior Authorization.  A Prior Authorization may be retroactively denied by BCBST if BCBST subsequently determines that (i.) the healthcare services sought were not included as Covered Services under the applicable Blue Cross Benefit Plan; (ii) such services were not Medically Necessary; (iii) the Member was ineligible for such services at the time the services were rendered; or (iv) the information submitted with the Prior Authorization request was not accurate and complete. If BCBST does not authorize a service that requires a Prior Authorization, Provider will not receive payment for such service.
MasterClauseData.UCH_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3ma: Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Professional Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program. Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Member_Protections_Maximization_of_B: Maximization of Benefits.  Provider acknowledges that BCBST may assist Members from time to time in maximizing their benefits, including through the use of care coordination activities, transparency tools and Member education.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Member_Protections_Member_Relations_: Member Relations.  Each Party to this Agreement, their staff, personnel, and agents will treat Members promptly, fairly and courteously, whether by phone, in person, or in writing. Both Parties, and their respective employees, will endeavor to maintain a high level of customer service and satisfaction.
MasterClauseData.UCH_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="UCH_Maximum_Allowable" Title="UCH_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>line level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. MasterClauseData.UCH_Definitions_Section_1: The following terms are defined for the purpose of this Attachment. All other capitalized terms have the same meaning as in the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Member_Protections_Open_Communicatio: Open Communication.  BCBST encourages open provider-patient communication regarding appropriate treatment alternatives. BCBST will not penalize Provider for discussing Medically Necessary care with Members.
MasterClauseData.UCH_Place_of_Service_Section_1.4: “Place of Service”  means the code used designate where the Covered Services occurred.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Member_Protections_Nondiscrimination: Nondiscrimination.  Provider will provide healthcare services to Members in accordance with recognized standards and within the same time frame as those services provided by Provider to Provider's patients that are not Members. Provider agrees not to differentiate or discriminate in the treatment of Members on the basis of race, sex, age, handicap, religion, national origin, or network reimbursement, and to observe, protect, and promote the rights of Members as patients. BCBST recognizes Provider's right to refuse to treat any Member for appropriate medical or professional reasons, in accordance with applicable state or federal law, provided that the reason for such refusal is not that the patient is a Member in a participating Blue Cross Benefit Plan.
MasterClauseData.UCH_Original_Medicare_Section_1.3: “Original Medicare” means the original entitlement Medicare Fee for Service program administered by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Identification_Card_Section_4.14: Identification Cards.  BCBST agrees to provide appropriate identification cards for BCBST Members, which may be in electronic, digital, or physical form. In order to ensure proper identification of each Member, Provider agrees to use reasonable efforts to verify the identity of the BCBST identification card-holder, including, but not necessarily limited to, checking a valid state-issued identification card, a validly-issued driver's license, or any other appropriate picture ID.
MasterClauseData.UCH_CPT_Code_Section_1.2: “CPT® Code” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Compliance_Section_4.13: Compliance.  The Parties agree to comply with all applicable federal and state laws, rules, and regulations related to this Agreement and the services to be provided hereunder, including, but not limited to, laws and regulations related to fraud, abuse, discrimination, disabilities, confidentiality, privacy, self-referral, false claims, and prohibition of kickbacks. Provider represents, warrants, and agrees that Provider has the requisite right and authority to submit Member-identifying information to BCBST for treatment, payment, and health care operations purposes and has obtained, if required by Applicable Law, the appropriate consent or authorization to share Member-identifying information with BCBST for all these purposes.
MasterClauseData.UCH_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Prevention_of_Surprise_Billing_to_Me: Prevention of Surprise Billing to Members.  In the event that Provider determines that it is necessary to refer any Member to another healthcare provider for the provision of Covered Services, Provider will ensure that such other healthcare provider is a Network Provider. Except as otherwise stated in writing between the Parties, Provider will guarantee that providers who are (i) employed or (ii) otherwise have a contractual relationship with Provider will participate in the same Networks as Provider. In the event that Provider fails to meet the above guarantee, BCBST, at its discretion and upon <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_OverallPaymentReductionDaysNotice" Title="CPA_OverallPaymentReductionDaysNotice" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true" /> #>30 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> prior written Notice to Provider, may reduce overall payment rates to Provider by up to <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PaymentReductionPercent" Title="CPA_PaymentReductionPercent" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true" /> #>2%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> for all Networks. Any such adjustment will apply on a prospective basis and will continue for any dates of service when one or more of the providers referenced above in (i) or (ii) are not in a particular Network in which Provider participates.
MasterClauseData.SCE_Exclusions_Section_3.2_p2: Services that are not covered by CMS under Original Medicare for sleep disorders.
Acceptance of Assignments.  Provider will accept assignments for the payment of services provided to Members. Provider will acquire and maintain all necessary evidence of assignments.

Accessibility of Provider.  Provider will be available to provide Covered Services to Members at all appropriate times in accordance with applicable BCBST policies and procedures and the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.SCE_Sleep_Center_Services_Section_3.1ma_: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provisions_of_Services_Eligibility_a: Eligibility and Coverage Determinations.  Either BCBST or the responsible Payor will have full discretionary authority to make eligibility and coverage determinations concerning services rendered to Members, in accordance with ERISA, and the terms of a Member's Blue Cross Benefit Plan. Provider will accept and abide by all such determinations, subject to its right to dispute such determinations pursuant to the “Resolution of Disputes” provision in this Agreement. Provider acknowledges that it has the right to request expedited reconsideration of an adverse benefit determination if Provider reasonably believes that determination will preclude a Member from receiving urgently needed services. Provider further acknowledges that such eligibility and coverage determinations are solely benefit determinations that will not limit or affect Provider's rights or responsibilities related to the care and treatment of its patients.
MasterClauseData.SCE_Sleep_Center_Services_Section_3.1ma_: <# <TrackedContent TrackName="SCE_Percent_Reimbursement_BCBST_Medicare_Base_Sleep_Center_Fee_Schedule" Title="SCE_Percent_Reimbursement_BCBST_Medicare_Base_Sleep_Center_Fee_Schedule" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Base Sleep Center Fee Schedule.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provisions_of_Services_Standards_Sec: Standards.  Provider will be responsible for the medical care and treatment and the maintenance of a patient relationship with each Member that Provider treats. Provider will provide only those services that it is licensed, credentialed, and qualified to provide, and will otherwise abide by the terms of this Agreement, the applicable Network Attachments, and the applicable Provider Manual. Provider acknowledges and agrees that any determinations made by BCBST pursuant to BCBST's Quality Improvement Program and Utilization Management Program are benefits and not treatment determinations. Provider is solely responsible for making treatment recommendations and decisions in consultation with its patients. Provider will only provide Covered Services that are: (i) Medically Necessary; and (ii) ordered by an appropriate Healthcare Professional.
