MasterClauseData.CPA_Provisions_of_Services_General_Secti: General.  Under the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Provider will provide Covered Services to Members in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement, Blue Cross Benefit Plans, and any applicable Network Attachments attached to this Agreement. Provider acknowledges and agrees that BCBST does not promise, warrant, or guarantee that Provider will be permitted to participate in any particular Network, or that Provider will render any type or volume of Covered Services to Members. Provider acknowledges that BCBST does not warrant that Members will choose to utilize Provider's services.
MasterClauseData.SCE_Sleep_Center_Services_Section_3.1_p3: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation, all services, equipment, and/or supplies, used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.SCE_Sleep_Center_Services_Section_3.1_p2: <# <TrackedContent TrackName="SCE_Percent_Reimbursement_BCBST_Base_Sleep_Center_Fee_Schedule" Title="SCE_Percent_Reimbursement_BCBST_Base_Sleep_Center_Fee_Schedule" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Base Sleep Study Fee Schedule, which is attached as Schedule 1 to this Attachment. BCBST implements updates to the Base Sleep Study Fee Schedule on April 1 of each year, based on the reimbursement in use by Medicare for like services as of January 1. Services provided between January 1 and March 31 will be reimbursed based on the previous year's Medicare reimbursement. Codes that are not listed in the BCBST Base Sleep Study Fee Schedule are not reimbursable when billed with Provider's sleep center provider identification number or NPI.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Associated_Providers_and_Entities_PR: Associated Providers and Entities.  If Provider desires to provide professional services at a new practice location or add a new Associated Provider to this Agreement, then such a change requires only advance notice and does not require an amendment signed by both parties. If Provider provides or arranges for Covered Services through Associated Providers and/or Entities, then any obligations under this Agreement applicable to Provider shall apply equally to such Associated Providers and Entities, as applicable. Provider shall bind all Associated Providers and Entities to the terms of this Agreement and Provider is responsible for ensuring Associated Providers' and Entities' compliance with this Agreement. In the event an Associated Provider or Entity is not credentialed until after the Effective Date, such Associated Provider or Entity shall not be a Participating Provider and shall not be permitted to perform services under this Agreement until they are credentialed. Provider represents that they have obtained each Associated Provider's acknowledgement and consent that this Agreement supersedes the terms of any individual agreement such Associated Provider has with BCBST for purposes of such Associated Provider's participation with Provider under this Agreement.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Limitation_on_Provider_and_Third_Par: Limitation on Provider and Third Parties.  Provider is entering into this Agreement for itself and on behalf of the Entities listed on Exhibit 1A. This Agreement is entered into by Provider with the understanding that this Agreement will not constitute an agreement between Provider and other third parties that are parties to similar agreements or contracts. Provider agrees that this Agreement does not constitute an agreement that Provider may act as agent for any third party that becomes party to a similar agreement or impose any liability upon any third party by reason of any act or acts of omission or commission on its part. If Provider desires to add a new Entity to this Agreement, both Parties agree that Exhibit 1A must be amended in a writing signed by both Parties.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Independence_of_the_Parties_Section_: Independence of the Parties.  Provider expressly acknowledges its understanding that this Agreement constitutes a legally binding agreement between Provider and BCBST. BCBST and Provider are independent legal entities contracting with each other solely to carry out the terms of this Agreement for the purposes stated herein. Nothing in this Agreement will be construed or be deemed to create a relationship other than that of independent parties. BCBST is an independent corporation operating under a license from the BCBSA, permitting BCBST to use the BCBS Marks, and that BCBST is not contracting as the agent of the BCBSA. Provider acknowledges and agrees that it has not entered into this Agreement based upon representations by any Person other than BCBST, and that no Person other than BCBST will be held accountable or liable to Provider for any of BCBST's obligations to Provider created under this Agreement.

No retroactive adjustments will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS's release of a rate and BCBST's implementation of such rate in accordance with the Provider Manual or due to CMS's retroactive implementation of an amended rate.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Change_of_Control_Section_2.6: “Change of Control” means the occurrence of any of the following: (a) direct or indirect sale, transfer, conveyance or other disposition (other than by way of merger, consolidation, reorganization or conversion), in one or a series of related transactions, of all or a majority of the properties or assets of Provider; (b) the consummation of any transaction (including, without limitation, any merger, consolidation, reorganization or conversion) the result of which is that a Person that is not an Affiliate prior to the transaction becomes the beneficial owner, directly or indirectly, of more than 25% of the then-outstanding number of units, interests, or shares of the Provider's voting stock (or membership interests or other equity); (c) a Person that is not an Affiliate prior to the transaction assumes substantial operational control of Provider or one or more service lines, departments, or ancillary services provided by Provider, including but not limited to operational control exercised through the entry into, or change in, an agreement for a Person that is not an Affiliate prior to the transaction to provide management or outsourcing services to Provider; or (d) there is a change to a Person that has the authority to appoint individuals to Provider's Board of Directors or equivalent governing board.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Blue_Cross_Benefit_Plan_Section_2.5: “Blue Cross Benefit Plan” means an agreement entered into by BCBST or any of its Affiliates with a Person for the purpose of insuring or administering Covered Services by BCBST or one of its Affiliates.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Year_Two_Section_1.8: “Year Two” means the calendar year following Year One. If Provider has already reached Year Two under a prior professional provider agreement under a QIP attachment, then Provider will remain in Year Two.
MasterClauseData.CPA_BCBS_Marks_Section_2.4: “BCBS Marks” means the trademarks, names, logos, symbols and service marks owned by the BCBSA.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Year_One_Section_1.7: “Year One” means: (1) in the event that Provider did not participate in any of BCBST's MA Networks prior to the BlueAdvantage MA PPO Fixed Term and the BlueAdvantage MA PPO Fixed Term begins between July 1 and December 31, the remainder of the calendar year in which the BlueAdvantage MA PPO Fixed Term begins and the following calendar year; and (2) in all other instances, the calendar year in which the BlueAdvantage MA PPO Fixed Term begins.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Utilization_Management_Program_Secti: “Utilization Management Program” means the BCBST program which focuses on the medical review of healthcare services provided to Members, as described in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Quality_Rating_Section_1.6: “Quality Rating” means the overall rating, based on a five-point scale, assigned by BCBST to Provider on an annual basis, based on Provider's performance on Performance Measures across all BCBST MA Networks in which Provider participates (except for and excluding the BlueCare Plus MA HMO DSNP Network), relative to the performance targets set by CMS for the same Performance Measures.  Quality Ratings are calculated based on claims and data submitted for the previous calendar year through February 1 of the year for which the Quality Rating is applied. New Quality Ratings are effective on April 1 of each year, beginning in Year Two (as defined herein).
MasterClauseData.CPA_Quality_Improvement_Program_Section_: “Quality Improvement Program” means the BCBST program which focuses on monitoring and enhancing the quality of healthcare services rendered to Members, as described in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Preformance_Measures_Section_1.5: “Performance Measures” means, for any given year, those quality and performance measures that are measurable at the individual provider level and reasonably determined by BCBST to be applicable to Provider. These measures are identified by CMS as the basis for CMS's five-star ratings program, as well as additional data. The list of Performance Measures is set out in Exhibit 1, which is attached and incorporated into this Attachment; however, this list is subject to change in subsequent calendar years upon written notice from BCBST through amendment to this Addendum, publication in the Provider Manual, and/or publication in a BCBST BlueAlert.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provider_Manual_Section_2.34: “Provider Manual” means the applicable manual(s) set forth on the BCBST website(s) that contain information, including, but not limited to, medical and operating policies and procedures established by BCBST for Network Providers.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Prior_Authorization_Section_2.33: “Prior Authorization” means an authorization obtained from BCBST for the provision of Covered Services prior to the delivery of that service or period of confinement, as described in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Original_Medicare_Section_1.3: “Original Medicare” means the original entitlement Medicare Fee for Service program administered by CMS
MasterClauseData.CPA_Physician_Section_2.32: “Physician” means an individual licensed to practice medicine or osteopathy by the state(s) in which he or she practices such profession.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Member_Experience_Section_1.2_p2: “Member Experience: HOS” means those individual member experience measures identified as: Improving Bladder Control, and Reducing the Risk of Falling.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Person_Section_2.31: “Person” means any natural person, corporation, general partnership, limited partnership, limited liability company, proprietorship, other business organization, trust, union, association, or governmental or regulatory authority, whether domiciled in the United States or one of its territories.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Member_Experience_Section_1.2_p1: “Member Experience: CAHPS” means those individual member experience measures identified as: Getting Appointments and Care Quickly, and Care Coordination.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Payor_Section_2.30: “Payor” means a person or entity that is responsible for paying for Covered Services in accordance with the terms of the Blue Cross Benefit Plan under which the Member being treated is covered.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_Definitions_Section_1.1s: The following terms are defined for the purposes of this Attachment. All other capitalized terms have the same meaning as in the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Exclusions_Section_3.2_p2: Any other charges or services, which are excluded by Original Medicare.
MasterClauseData.CPA_BCBSA_Section_2.3: “BCBSA” means the BlueCross BlueShield Association, an association of independent BlueCross BlueShield licensees.
MasterClauseData.PPCA_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Exclusions_Section_3.2_p1: Exclusions.  The following are specifically excluded from payment under this Attachment:
MasterClauseData.CPA_Outpatient_Encounter_Section_2.29_pr: “Outpatient Encounter” means services provided by the Provider to a Member who (i) has not been admitted to Provider for an Inpatient Stay, (ii) is registered on the Provider records as an outpatient, and (iii) is physically present at the Provider while receiving the services. The Outpatient Encounter lasts from the time the Member is registered until the Member is discharged from the Provider or is admitted for an Inpatient Stay.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_BMAT_Services_Section_3.1_p2: The payments set out in the chart above are all inclusive, including without limitation, all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_BMAT_Services_Section_3.1_p1: Buprenorphine Medication Assisted Treatment Services. Payment for BMAT Covered Services is:
MasterClauseData.CPA_Notice_Section_2.28: “Notice” means notice provided in accordance with the “Notice” provision in this Agreement. For purposes of Notice under this Agreement, electronic notification, i.e. DocuSign® or other method of email, satisfies the requirements of written notification.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4_p2: BCBST shall only pay for BMAT Covered Services when billed with the appropriate CPT®/ HCPCS Codes as listed herein or described in the Provider Manual. Professional Provider must comply with any BCBST and/or pharmacy benefit manager requirements as it pertains to buprenorphine prescribing.
MasterClauseData.CPA_NonReimbursable_Services_Section_2.2: “Non-Reimbursable Services” means those services and supplies that would have been Covered Services but for the fact that the Provider (i) rendered services or supplies that were not Medically Necessary; (ii) failed to comply with applicable Quality Improvement Program or Utilization Management Program requirements; or (iii) failed to submit a claim for such services or supplies within the submission deadlines established in the “Submission of Charges” provision in this Agreement. “Non-Reimbursable Services” also include Non-Contracted Services as set forth in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4_p1: Use of Codes.  The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.CPA_NonPatient_Member_PROV_Section_2.26: “Non-Patient Member” means a Member who is not at Provider as part of an Inpatient Stay or Outpatient Encounter but who (i) has a specimen, scan, screening, or any other result (collectively and generally, “Test”) that is submitted for analysis or billing by Provider and the Member is not physically present at Provider at the time of the Test or (ii) receives durable medical equipment that is submitted for billing by Provider and the Member is not physically present at Provider.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3m: Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Professional Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program. Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_NonCovered_Services_Section_2.25: “Non-Covered Services” means those services and supplies that are not included in Covered Services, or are specifically excluded from, or subject to a limitation of, coverage pursuant to the terms of the Provider Manual or the Member's Blue Cross Benefit Plan. Non-Covered Services are not the same as Non-Reimbursable Services, the definition of which is set forth below.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3m: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_Provider_Section_2.24: “Network Provider” means a healthcare provider contracted to provide Covered Services to Members enrolled in a Blue Cross Benefit Plan
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_Participation_Criteria_Secti: “Network Participation Criteria” means the minimum qualifications and standards required in order to be considered and selected to participate in a Network, as described in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BHMA_Billing_Requirements" Title="BHMA_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>CMS 1500 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_Attachment_Section_2.22: “Network Attachment” means an attachment or exhibit to this Agreement that describes the rates to be paid to Provider for provision of certain services to BCBST Members accessing a particular Network. Network Attachments may also include specific terms or conditions applicable only to Provider's participation in that Network.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1ma_p2: Payments made by BCBST will be net of Member Obligations required from the Member, if any, according to the Member's BlueAdvantage benefits.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_Section_2.21: “Network” means a group of providers that has agreed to accept a pre-determined method or rate of payment for Covered Services provided to select Members.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1ma_p1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BHMA_Maximum_Allowable" Title="BHMA_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>line level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Member_Obligations_Section_2.20: “Member Obligation(s)” means any and all charges that a Network Provider may collect directly from a Member as the Member's portion of payment for Covered Services, including the copayments, deductibles and coinsurance amounts described in the Member's Blue Cross Benefit Plan.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BHMA_Maximum_Allowable" Title="BHMA_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>line level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Definitions_Section_1: The following terms are defined for the purpose of this Attachment. All other capitalized terms have the same meaning as in the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Associated_Provider_Section_2.2_prof: “Associated Provider” means the Healthcare Professional(s) that serve as partners, associates, employees, etc., of the Provider. Without limiting the foregoing, in the event that Provider is a group practice, management services organization, clinically integrated network, accountable care organization, or independent physician association (“IPA”) or similar entity that contracts on behalf of Healthcare Professionals, “Associated Provider” includes any Healthcare Professional that contracts with BCBST through this Agreement
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Original_Medicare_Section_1.7: “Original Medicare” means the original entitlement Medicare Fee for Service program administered by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Members_Section_2.19: “Member(s)” means an individual eligible to receive Covered Services under a Blue Cross Benefit Plan.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Medically_Necessary_Section_2.18: “Medically Necessary” means the definition of the term “medically necessary” as set forth in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_Opioid_Use_Disorder_Section_1.6:
“Opioid Use Disorder” (“OUD”) refers to what was introduced in the DSM5 as a combination of prior diagnoses of Opioid Dependence and Opioid Abuse. The diagnosis includes the opiate heroin and synthetic
painkillers such as OxyContin.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.17: “Maximum Allowable” means the amount that the Payor has determined to be the maximum amount payable for a Covered Service, which will be the lesser of billed charges or the established fee for the services performed as set forth in the applicable Network Attachment.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_HCPCS_Code_Section_1.5: “HCPCS Code” means Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System based on the AMA's Current Procedural Technology (“CPT®”) and updated by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Investigational_Section_2.16: “Investigational” means the definition of the term “investigational” as set forth in the applicable Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_CPT_Code_Section_1.4: “CPT® Code” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Inpatient_Stay_Section_2.15_prov: “Inpatient Stay(s)” means a Member (i) is admitted to Provider in an inpatient setting, (ii) is physically present at Provider, (iii) and the admitting physician has documented that the member's condition, safety, or health supports providing care in an inpatient setting rather than a less intensive setting.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_CMS_Section_1.3: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
“Buprenorphine Medication Assisted Treatment (BMAT) Program Description” refers to the BCBST guidance document, which by this reference is incorporated herein, and is also available at www.bcbst.com.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Healthcare_Professional_Section_2.14: “Healthcare Professional(s)” means a physician, doctor of osteopathy, podiatrist, dentist, chiropractor, midwife, nurse, optometrist, or other individual licensed or certified to practice a healthcare profession by the state or states in which he or she practices such profession.
MasterClauseData.BHMA_BMAT_Provider_Attestation_Form_Sect: “Buprenorphine Medication Assisted Treatment Provider Attestation Form” refers to the document that must be completed and signed by each prescribing Professional Provider prior to enrollment in and eligibility for reimbursement under the BMAT Program. A copy of the BMAT Program Description is available at www.bcbst.com.
MasterClauseData.CPA_ERISA_Section_2.13: “ERISA” means the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended, and the rules and regulations promulgated pursuant thereto.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Exclusions_Section_3.2_p2: Any other charges or services, which are excluded by Original Medicare.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Entity_or_Entities_Section_2.12: “Entity or Entities” means a provider, including a healthcare facility or Healthcare Professional, with a unique Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN), National Provider Identifier (NPI), location, or taxonomy.

MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_BMAT_Services_Section_3.1_p2: The payments set out in the chart above are all inclusive, including without limitation, all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Dispute_Resolution_Process_Section_2: “Dispute Resolution Process” means the process set forth in the Provider Manual to resolve disputes between the Parties, including the applicable Provider Dispute Resolution Procedure and the Medical Management Corrective Action Plan (each as defined in the applicable Provider Manual).

MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4_p2: BCBST shall only pay for BMAT Covered Services when billed with the appropriate CPT®/ HCPCS Codes as listed herein or described in the Provider Manual. Professional Provider must comply with any BCBST and/or pharmacy benefit manager requirements as it pertains to buprenorphine prescribing.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Affilate_Section_2.1: “Affiliate(s)” means (i) any Person that directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls or is controlled by, or is under common control with, the Person specified (for purposes of this definition, “control” of a Person means the power, direct or indirect, to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of such Person whether by contract or otherwise, and, in any event, and without limitation of the previous sentence, any Person owning <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_AffiliateOwnershipPercent" Title="CPA_AffiliateOwnershipPercent" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true" /> #>50%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or more of the voting securities of another Person will be deemed to control that Person); or (ii) any Person that has been licensed by the BCBSA to use any of the BCBS Marks, regardless of any common control requirements or lack of control.  For the avoidance of doubt, any licensed Person is related to BCBST as a separate and distinct licensee of BCBSA.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_and_Termination_Section_19.6: Term and Termination.  The following termination provisions apply to the MA Networks in addition to those contained in the “Term; Termination” provision of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4_p1: Use of Codes.  The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provisions_Surviving_Termination_Sec: Provisions Surviving Termination.  The following provisions of the “Medicare   Advantage Networks” provision shall survive any termination of this Agreement: “Confidentiality”, “Compliance”, “Record Maintenance”, and “Continuation of Services after Termination” provisions in this Agreement.
Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Professional Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program. Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Immediate_Termination_Upon_Exclusion: Immediate Termination Upon Exclusion.  Provider's participation in the MA Networks will immediately terminate upon Provider's exclusion from participating in federal health programs.
Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Termination_of_Medicare_Benefit_Prog: Termination of Medicare Benefit Program.  Provider's participation in the MA Networks will terminate immediately upon the official cancellation of BCBST's contract with CMS or on the official date of discontinuance of BCBST's Medicare Benefit Program, whichever is later.
Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BHCOMM_Billing_Requirements" Title="BHCOMM_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>CMS 1500 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Hold_Harmless_DualEligible_Members_S: Hold Harmless; Dual-Eligible Members.  Provider will not hold Medicare Members liable for payment of any fees that are the legal obligation of BCBST. Provider further agrees that, for all Medicare Members eligible for both Medicare and Medicaid, such Medicare Members will not be held liable for Medicare Part A and B cost sharing when the State is responsible for paying such amounts. Provider agrees to: (1) accept BCBST payment as payment in full, or (2) bill the appropriate State source. Provider will be informed of Medicare and Medicaid benefits and rules for Medicare Members eligible for Medicare and Medicaid. Provider and BCBST may not impose cost-sharing that exceeds the amount of cost-sharing that would be permitted with respect to the individual under title XIX if the individual were not enrolled in BCBST.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1ma_p: Payments made by BCBST will be net of Member Obligations required from the Member, if any, according to the Member's BlueAdvantage benefits.
MasterClauseData.CPA_PlanDirected_Care_Section_19.5.d_p2: For services that require Prior Authorization or predetermination, BCBST's authorization procedures must be followed. If a Medicare Member proceeds to receive care at the direction of Provider, believing that such care was verbally or otherwise authorized by Provider, the Medicare Member cannot be held financially responsible. In such cases where Provider failed to follow BCBST's authorization protocols, BCBST may decline to pay the claim, in which case Provider will be held financially liable for the services received by the Medicare Member. CMS prohibits holding the Medicare Member liable in such cases.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1ma_p: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BHCOMM_Maximum_Allowable" Title="BHCOMM_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>line level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.CPA_PlanDirected_Care_Section_19.5.d_p1: Plan-Directed Care.  CMS considers plan-directed care to be the financial responsibility of the health plan and/or its contracted network, but in either case, not the responsibility of the Medicare Member. Plan-directed care is care the Member believes they were instructed to obtain, or authorized to receive and such instruction and/or authorization was provided by a health plan representative. Under CMS's guidance, a representative of the health plan includes plan-contracted providers. Therefore, Provider must obtain authorization from BCBST prior to referring a Medicare Member to an out-of-network provider.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BHCOMM_Maximum_Allowable" Title="BHCOMM_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>line level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Prohibition_on_Balance_Billing_Secti: In addition, Provider will not charge Medicare Members any fees, surcharges or sales, use or other applicable tax for Covered Services. If BCBST receives notice of any additional charges or balance billing, Provider will fully cooperate with BCBST to investigate such allegations and will promptly refund any improper payments collected.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Definitions_Section_1: The following terms are defined for the purpose of this Attachment. All other capitalized terms have the same meaning as in the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Prohibition_on_Balance_Billing_Secti: Prohibition on Balance Billing.  Provider may not bill or collect from the Medicare Member or any third party for services, procedures, drugs, supplies or home medical equipment that are not Medically Necessary or that are denied in a Medicare coverage determination issued by BCBST as explained in the Provider Manual and/or as set forth in the Medicare Benefit Contract. Provider may collect, however, for a specific service, procedure, drug, supply or item of home medical equipment where services are not Medically Necessary or benefits are not payable pursuant to a Medicare coverage determination, if, prior to the service being provided, Provider requested a pre-determination on the Member's behalf and BCBST has issued a CMS-10003 Notice of Denial of Medical Coverage.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Original_Medicare_Section_1.7: “Original Medicare” means the original entitlement Medicare Fee for Service program administered by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Prompt_Payment_Section_19.5.b: Prompt Payment.  Unless a claim for payment is disputed, BCBST will promptly make payment on each Clean Claim, timely submitted by Provider, for Covered Services rendered to a Medicare Member, within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_CleanClaimPromptPayment" Title="CPA_CleanClaimPromptPayment" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30 calendar days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>. All payments will be made in accordance with BCBST policies.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_Opioid_Use_Disorder_Section_1.6:
“Opioid Use Disorder” (“OUD”) refers to what was introduced in the DSM5 as a combination of prior diagnoses of Opioid Dependence and Opioid Abuse. The diagnosis includes the opiate heroin and synthetic
painkillers such as OxyContin.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Timely_Submission_of_Claims_Section_: Timely Submission of Claims.  Provider will file claims within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_TimelySubmissionofClaims" Title="CPA_TimelySubmissionofClaims" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>365 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> from the date of service. Claims that are not filed, including the submission of any revisions or adjustments, within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_TimelySubmissionofClaims" Title="CPA_TimelySubmissionofClaims" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>365 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the date of service will be denied. Provider will not bill Medicare Members for claims that are denied due to Provider's failure to timely submit the claim.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_HCPCS_Code_Section_1.5: “HCPCS Code” means Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System based on the AMA's Current Procedural Technology (“CPT®”) and updated by CMS.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_CPT_Code_Section_1.4: “CPT® Code” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Coverage_Determinations_Section_19.4: Coverage Determinations. In addition to the guidelines set forth in the “Provision of Services” provision in this Agreement, BCBST will make determinations of whether services provided to Medicare Members are Covered Services in accordance with the coverage guidelines established by the Medicare Benefit Program.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_CMS_Section_1.3: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Delegation_Section_19.4.b._p2: To the extent Provider renders Covered Services to Members under arrangements with another healthcare provider, BCBST hereby delegates to Provider responsibility under BCBST's Medicare Advantage contract with CMS to provide such services as set forth in this Agreement. Provider agrees that BCBST may only delegate such responsibilities in a manner consistent with the standards set forth under 42 C.F.R. §422.504(i)(3) and (4). Provider agrees that BCBST or CMS, consistent with obligations under the Medicare Advantage program, may revoke this delegation and terminate Provider's participation in MA Networks if Provider does not perform satisfactorily or if any of Provider's reporting and disclosure obligations are not fully met in a timely manner. In the event of such delegation, Provider acknowledges that BCBST will oversee and monitor Provider's performance on an ongoing basis. Provider further acknowledges that BCBST is accountable to CMS for the functions and responsibilities described in its Medicare Advantage contract with CMS and applicable regulatory standards.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_BMAT_Program_Description_Section_: “Buprenorphine Medication Assisted Treatment (BMAT) Program Description” refers to the BCBST guidance document, which by this reference is incorporated herein, and is also available at www.bcbst.com.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Delegation_Section_19.4.b._p1: Delegation.  To the extent that BCBST delegates to Provider any of its administrative responsibilities (e.g. credentialing) such delegation will be specified in a separate agreement that is compliant with CMS regulations and BCBST policies and procedures. No administrative delegation is presumed under this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.BHCOMM_BMAT_Provider_Attestation_Form_Se: “Buprenorphine Medication Assisted Treatment Provider Attestation Form” refers to the document that must be completed and signed by each prescribing Professional Provider prior to enrollment in and eligibility for reimbursement under the BMAT Program. A copy of the BMAT Program Description is available at www.bcbst.com.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Administrative_and_Compliance_Respon: Administrative and Compliance Responsibilities.  BCBST will perform or arrange for the performance of all administrative responsibilities necessary under this Agreement for the provision of Covered Services to Medicare Members except as otherwise specified herein. BCBST will have the sole responsibility for filing reports, obtaining approval from, and complying with, the applicable laws and regulations of federal, state and local governmental agencies having jurisdiction over BCBST. Such compliance accountability includes monitoring of Provider's compliance with applicable regulations. BCBST will perform all the necessary administrative, accounting, enrollment and other functions appropriate for the marketing and administration of its Medicare Benefit Program. BCBST may elect to contract with persons and/or entities to perform such responsibilities and functions on behalf of BCBST.
MasterClauseData.BCE_The_PPV_Reversible_LAC_fee_schedule_: The Post-Partum Voluntary Reversible Long-Acting Contraceptives fee schedule. (“VRLAC Fee Schedule”) is available to State of Tennessee Health Plan (“SEHP”) participants.  Provider will be reimbursed at 100% of the VRLAC Fee Schedule for Covered Services provided to SEHP participants in addition to the Inpatient Stay Payment Rate.
MasterClauseData.BCE_Birthing_Center_Transfer_Rate_Sectio: Birthing Center Transfer Rate.  In cases where the Member is transferred to an acute care facility prior to delivery, Provider will receive the transfer rate described below:
MasterClauseData.CPA_Provider_Representations_and_Warrant: Provider Representations and Warranties.  Provider warrants that Provider is duly qualified and approved to act as a provider of health care services to Medicare Beneficiaries under Title XVIII of the Social Security Act (whether considered "participating" in Medicare or not). Further, Provider represents and warrants to BCBST that (a) neither Provider nor any of its Affiliates are excluded from participation in any federal health care program, as defined under 42 U.S.C. §1320a-7b (f); (b) Provider has not arranged or contracted (by employment or otherwise) with any employee, contractor, Downstream Entity, or agent that Provider or its Affiliates know or should know are excluded from participation in any federal health care program to provide items or services hereunder; and (c) no final adverse action, as such term is defined under 42 U.S.C. §1320a-7e (g), has occurred or is pending or threatened against Provider or its Affiliates or to Provider's knowledge against any employee, contractor or agent engaged to provide items or services under this Agreement (collectively "Exclusions/Adverse Actions"). Provider, during the term of this Agreement, will notify BCBST of any Exclusions/Adverse Actions or any basis therefore within two (2) business days of Provider's learning of any such Exclusions/Adverse Actions or any basis therefore.
MasterClauseData.BCE_Birthing_Center_Case_Rates_Section_3: Birthing Center Case Rates.  The Case Rates below are all-inclusive and will fully compensate Provider for all services and supplies provided in association with birthing center Covered Services. Only services billed with the CPT® Codes shown below are eligible for reimbursement under this Attachment.
Provider's Notices.  Provider will notify BCBST, in writing, within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_NoticeMEDIMEDSuspExcl" Title="CPA_NoticeMEDIMEDSuspExcl" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of: (a) any termination, suspension, limitation, voluntary surrender or restriction of Provider's license, accreditation, certification, or other governmental authorization; (b) failure to maintain any insurance as required herein; (c) Provider's conviction of a felony or any other criminal charge relating to Provider; (d) any disciplinary action taken by a state licensing board, or other governmental agency; (e) Provider's suspension or exclusion from participation in the Medicare or Medicaid programs; or (f) any other legal, governmental or other action or event which may materially impair the Provider's ability to perform any duties and obligations under this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.BCE_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4: Use of Codes.  The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Subcontracted_Providers_Section_19.3: Subcontracted Providers.  To the extent Provider provides any Covered Services for Medicare Members through a subcontract with another healthcare provider, the following will apply: (i) Provider acknowledges that the subcontracted provider will be considered a Downstream Entity; (ii) Provider agrees to pay the Downstream Entity promptly in accordance with CMS rules and regulations and to comply with any other laws and regulations related to payment, administration or oversight of Covered Services rendered to a Medicare Member; (iii) Provider will provide a copy of this Agreement to the Downstream Entity; (iv) Provider agrees and acknowledges that BCBST retains the right to approve, suspend, or terminate any delegation/subcontract by Provider to furnish Covered Services; (v) Provider agrees that any such delegation or subcontract, will be performed by the Downstream Entity in accordance with BCBST's contractual obligations to CMS, Provider's contractual obligations hereunder, and all applicable Medicare laws, regulations and CMS instructions; and (vi) Provider agrees that any agreements of Provider with respect to any subcontract/delegation will be in writing, signed by the Parties, and will specifically obligate the Downstream Entity to comply with all of the provisions of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.BCE_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described herein, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Continuation_of_Services_after_Termi: Continuation of Services after Termination.  After termination of Provider's participation in BCBST's MA Networks, BCBST will be liable for payment for Covered Services rendered by Provider to a Medicare Member who retains eligibility or is under the care of Provider at the time of termination, other than for applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, until the services being rendered to the Medicare Member by Provider are completed, unless BCBST makes reasonable and medically appropriate provision for the assumption of such services by another Network Provider. BCBST will reimburse Provider for all services rendered pursuant to this Section at Medicare allowable assignment rates, and Provider will accept such payment, together with any authorized Member Obligation, as payment in full. This continuation of Covered Services and hold harmless obligation will be for the period for which the Medicare Member's premium has been paid to BCBST by CMS, not to exceed a period of 30 days, except for those Medicare Members who are hospitalized on an inpatient basis. Provider will continue to arrange for Covered Services for those Medicare Members who are hospitalized on an inpatient basis as of the date of termination of Provider's participation in the MA Networks until the Medicare Member is discharged from the hospital.
MasterClauseData.BCE_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BCE_Billing_Requirements" Title="BCE_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>CMS 1450 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reports_and_Administration_Section_1: Reports and Administration.  Provider agrees to provide BCBST with encounter data, risk adjustment data, and other informational data sufficient to meet BCBST's reporting obligations to CMS. BCBST will perform all the necessary administrative, accounting, enrollment and other functions appropriate for the administration of its Medicare Benefit Program.
MasterClauseData.BCE_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="BCE_Maximum_Allowable" Title="BCE_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>claim level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
Record Maintenance.  Provider will maintain adequate medical, financial and administrative records related to Covered Services rendered to Medicare Members. Unless a longer time period is required by applicable statutes or regulations, Provider will maintain, and BCBST, the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), the Comptroller General, the General Accounting Office, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), or the designees of any of the foregoing, and, as applicable, the National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) or its designee will have the right to audit, inspect, review and make copies of, any books, contracts, computer or other electronic systems, including medical records and documentation, and other records maintained by Provider, its subcontractors or related entities, related to CMS's contract with BCBST or to Covered Services provided to Medicare Members under this Agreement, through ten (10) years from the final date of the contract period or from the date of the completion of any audit, whichever is later.
MasterClauseData.BCE_Revenue_Code_Section_1.4: “Revenue Code” means a hospital Revenue Code as adopted by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Prohibition_on_Removal_of_Medicare_M: Prohibition on Removal of Medicare Members.  Neither Provider, Provider's employees nor Provider's subcontractors will request, demand, require or otherwise seek, directly or indirectly, the termination from the Medicare Benefit Plan of any Medicare Member based upon the Medicare Member's need for or use of medically required services, or in order to gain financially or otherwise from such termination. Provider may request that BCBST terminate coverage of a Medicare Member for reasons of fraud, disruption of medical services, or failure to follow a physician's orders, or for any of the reasons specified by CMS for mandatory disenrollment. However, Provider agrees that BCBST will have sole and ultimate authority to terminate a Medicare Member's coverage, and Provider understands that any requested termination is subject to prior approval by CMS.
MasterClauseData.BCE_CPT_Code_Section_1.3: “CPT® Code” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code created by the American Medical Association (AMA). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Advice_to_Medicare_Members_Section_1: Advice to Medicare Members.  Nothing in this Agreement is intended to prohibit or restrict Provider from advising or advocating on behalf of a Medicare Member regarding (1) the Medicare Member's health status, medical care, or treatment options (including alternative treatments that may be self-administered), including providing sufficient information to the Medicare Member to provide an opportunity to decide among all relevant treatment options, (2) the risks, benefits and consequences of treatment or non-treatment, and (3) the opportunity for the Medicare Member to refuse treatment and express preferences about future treatment decisions. Provider must provide information regarding treatment options in a culturally competent manner, including the option of no treatment. Provider must assure that individuals with disabilities are furnished with effective communications in making decisions regarding treatment options. Provider will have procedures to inform Medicare Members of follow-up care and provide training in self-care as necessary.
MasterClauseData.BCE_CMS_Section_1.2: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Compliance_Section_19.3.c._p2: Provider further agrees that any Covered Services provided to Medicare Members will be consistent with and comply with BCBST's contractual obligations to CMS, as required by 42 C.F.R. §422.504(i)(3)(iii).
MasterClauseData.BCE_Case_Rate_Section_1.1: “Case Rate” means the all-inclusive rate for Covered Services, as described herein.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Compliance_Section_19.3.c._p1: Compliance.  Provider agrees to comply with BCBST's policies and procedures and all applicable federal and state laws, rules and regulations, including Medicare laws and regulations and CMS instructions, now or hereafter in effect regarding the performance of Provider's obligations hereunder, including without limitation, laws or regulations governing record timeliness, adequacy and accuracy, the regulations promulgated in 42 C.F.R. §422 et. seq., and the appeal and dispute resolution procedures related to Covered Services provided to Medicare Members. Provider agrees to comply with all federal laws on fraud, waste and abuse, as well as the HIPAA Implication Rules at 45 C.F.R. §160, 162 and 164.

Availability.  Provider will have hours of operation that are generally convenient to Medicare Members and do not discriminate against Medicare enrollees. Provider will make services available on a 24 hours a day/7 days a week basis.
MasterClauseData.OPEMA_Outpatient_Rehabilitation_Services: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services.
Confidentiality.  Provider agrees to abide by all federal and state laws regarding confidentiality and disclosure of medical records, or other health and enrollment information, including the confidentiality requirements established by BCBST and the Medicare Advantage program as set forth at 42 C.F.R. §422.118. Provider will ensure that medical information is only released in accordance with applicable federal or state law, or pursuant to court orders and subpoenas. Provider will maintain records in an accurate and timely manner and will ensure timely access by Medicare Members to the records and information that pertain to them.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Medicare_Member_Section_19.2.e: “Medicare Member” means a Beneficiary who has elected to enroll in the Medicare Benefit Program through a Blue Cross Benefit Plan offered by BCBST and whose enrollment with BCBST has been confirmed by CMS. For purposes of this Section, all references in this Agreement to “Members” will be interpreted as referring to Medicare Members.

MasterClauseData.BHABA_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4_p2: The CPT® Codes eligible for reimbursement under this Attachment are those listed in the attached Schedule 1A Applied Behavioral Analysis Fee Schedule.  BCBST will assign a reasonable fee to new or revised codes.  Provider may periodically request an updated version of Schedule 1A.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Downstream_Entity_Section_19.2.c: “Downstream Entity” means any party that enters into a written arrangement, acceptable to CMS, with persons or entities involved with the Medicare Advantage benefit, below the level of the arrangement between a Medicare Advantage Organization (or applicant) and a first tier entity. These written arrangements continue down to the level of the ultimate provider of both health and administrative services.

No retroactive adjustments will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS's release of a rate and BCBST's implementation of such rate in accordance with the Provider Manual or due to CMS's retroactive implementation of an amended rate.

Either Party may terminate Provider's participation in the Behavioral Health Network effective after the Behavioral Health Network Fixed Term pursuant to the “Without Cause Termination” provision or any other applicable termination provisions in this Agreement.

MasterClauseData.BFS_Technical_Component_for_Professional: For all claims with dates of service on or after January 1, 2019, and notwithstanding any other language to the contrary, Commercial DRG and outpatient case rates paid to a facility (other than free-standing ambulatory surgery centers) are all-inclusive of any technical component for professional services provided while a Member is in a facility setting.  The facility shall bill for the technical component of the services, even if these services are provided under arrangements with or subcontracted out to or otherwise subject to or governed by a relationship with another entity, such as a laboratory, pathologist, or other provider.  Payment shall not be made to Provider under this Network Attachment or otherwise under this Agreement for technical component services furnished to Members in facility settings (other than free-standing ambulatory surgery centers).  All Providers who perform the technical component for professional services for Members must coordinate with the applicable facility (other than a free-standing ambulatory surgery center) regarding the payment of claims for such services.

MasterClauseData.BFS_Reimbursement_Policy_p1: The table above, in conjunction with BCBST’s reimbursement policies, as fully detailed in the Provider Manual, sets forth the basis for calculating the established fee for Covered Services provided to BCBST <# <Conditional Test=“//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Provider_Specialty[text()='Chiropractic’]” /> #>FEP<# <EndConditional/> #> Members who receive benefits through <# <Content Select="//MergedElementsFromLoop/Row/Network_Name" Optional="true"/> #>. Any updates and/or changes to BCBST’s reimbursement policies will be communicated no later than sixty (60) days  prior to implementation thereof via BCBST’s standard method of notice.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Reimbursements_Section_18.3_p1: Reimbursement.  For Covered Services provided to Behavioral Health Network Members, BCBST will pay Provider the Maximum Allowable in accordance with the attached Behavioral Health Network Attachment, which is incorporated by reference into this Agreement, at the time of service, less any applicable Member Obligation.
MasterClauseData.BFS_Confidentiality: This Network Attachment is confidential and proprietary information of BCBST, protected under Tennessee Code Annotated § 56-7-1013.  It is not to be duplicated, distributed, or revised without the written consent of BCBST.
MasterClauseData.ORE_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_p1: Rate Updates.  Rates under the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule are equivalent to amounts that would have been payable under Original Medicare to Provider for the same services; provided however, that BCBST updates the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule in the timeframes described in the Provider Manual. No retroactive adjustments will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS’s release of a rate and BCBST’s implementation of such rate in accordance with the Provider Manual or due to CMS’s retroactive implementation of an amended rate.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Participation_Section_18.2: Participation.  Provider agrees to participate in BCBST's Behavioral Health Network for the purpose of providing health care Covered Services to Behavioral Health Network Members.
MasterClauseData.BFS_Code_Assignment_Exceptions: The fee source for most bands on this Network Attachment is the 2021 CMS RBRVS.  However, for new codes or codes for which CMS does not publish a fee or methodology (i.e., codes other than those with status code “A”) that fall into those categories, reimbursement will be based on a reasonable allowable determined by BCBST, as described in the Provider Manual.  In the event that CMS publishes a fee for a code for which it did not previously publish a fee, BCBST will implement such fee within a reasonable amount of time after publication.
MasterClauseData.ORE_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_m: Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program. Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.BFS_Chiropractic_Payment_p2: BCBST shall only pay for chiropractic Covered Services when billed with the appropriate CPT codes as listed herein or described in the Provider Manual. All chiropractic Covered Services, excluding DME, furnished by a licensed chiropractor, as defined in Tennessee Code Annotated Section 63-4-101, (“Chiropractor”) during a single office visit shall be paid at the global rate of $60.00 per visit.  Except when otherwise provided herein, the global rate in this section shall be all-inclusive and shall, in combination with any Member Cost Sharing Obligation(s) due by the applicable Member to the Provider, compensate Provider in full for all services and supplies provided in association with Covered Services provided by a Chiropractor.  All durable medical equipment (“DME”) Covered Services, furnished by Chiropractor, shall be paid at 75% of the current Medicare Region C DMEPOS Fee Schedule for Tennessee.  The rates for the DME Covered Services shall be in combination with any Member Cost Sharing Obligation(s) due by the applicable Member to the Provider.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Network_Behavioral_Health_Members_Se: “Behavioral Health Network Member(s)” means those BCBST Members whose health benefits are delivered through Network P, Network S, Network L, Network E, or any other BCBST Network that is not tied to a federal or state healthcare program (other than programs giving health benefits to current government employees) and whose benefits include coverage for behavioral health services.
MasterClauseData.BFS_Chiropractic_Payment_p1: BCBST shall only pay for chiropractic Covered Services when billed with the appropriate CPT codes as listed herein or described in the Provider Manual. Except for chiropractic Covered Services provided to FEP Members, all chiropractic Covered Services, excluding DME, furnished by a licensed chiropractor, as defined in Tennessee Code Annotated Section 63-4-101, (“Chiropractor”) during a single office visit shall be paid at the global rate of $60.00 per visit.  Except when otherwise provided herein, the global rate in this section shall be all-inclusive and shall, in combination with any Member Cost Sharing Obligation(s) due by the applicable Member to the Provider, compensate Provider in full for all services and supplies provided in association with Covered Services provided by a Chiropractor.  All durable medical equipment (“DME”) Covered Services, furnished by Chiropractor, shall be paid at 75% of the current Medicare Region C DMEPOS Fee Schedule for Tennessee.  The rates for the DME Covered Services shall be in combination with any Member Cost Sharing Obligation(s) due by the applicable Member to the Provider. Chiropractic Covered Services provided to FEP Members shall be paid in accordance with the appropriate FEP Network pricing as set forth in the attached FEP Chiropractic Network Attachment.  The Maximum Allowable for chiropractic Covered Services provided to FEP Members will be the lesser of Provider’s billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate fee amount in the FEP Chiropractic Rate Attachment.  All payment or fee amounts listed in the FEP Chiropractic Rate Attachment are subject to payment of lesser billed charges.
MasterClauseData.ORE_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_m: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.

MasterClauseData.BFS_Calculation_of_Established_Fee_p3: Notwithstanding any other provision in the Agreement, Network Attachment, or Provider Manual, as of April 1, 2021, BCBST reserves the right at its sole discretion not to implement one or more CMS changes to RBRVS, RVUs, GPCI, conversion factors, or other elements of the reimbursement methodology. MasterClauseData.BFS_Calculation_of_Established_Fee_p2: Other fee components, which are listed in the Guidelines for Resource Based Relative Value Scale (RBRVS) Reimbursement Methodology in the Provider Manual, may be updated to ensure that reimbursement is consistent with current usage of the code.  Updates to these components may result in increases or decreases to the established fee at the individual code level.
MasterClauseData.ORE_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ORE_Billing_Requirements" Title="ORE_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>CMS 1450 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. MasterClauseData.BFS_Calculation_of_Established_Fee_p1: For those procedure codes that fall into bands with a fee source of 2021 CMS RBRVS, the established fee will be calculated based on the Relative Value Units (RVUs), conversion factors and Geographic Practice Cost Indices (GPCIs) in effect as of October 31, 2021.  No updates will be made to these fee components, except: (1) any new procedure code added after October 31, 2021 will be added as noted above; or (2) in the event that the AMA modifies the code description, the underlying use of the code or the components that make up the code, BCBST will treat the code as a new code in order to remain consistent with recognized coding guidelines.
MasterClauseData.ORE_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable will be the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.

MasterClauseData.ASU_Outpatient_Surgery_Procedures_Sectio: When multiple surgical procedures are performed on the same day, the payment for the first procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ASU_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Title="ASU_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<#<EndTrackedContent/>#> of the Per Case payment, the payment for the second procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ASU_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Title="ASU_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>50%<#<EndTrackedContent/>#> of the Per Case payment, and the payment for the third procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ASU_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Title="ASU_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>0%<#<EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment. No additional payments will be made for procedures beyond the third procedure. When a procedure is repeated on the same day there will be no additional payment for the second procedure. Bilateral procedures will be paid in accordance with the Provider Manual.
