Drug codes submitted for consideration, but not shown on the Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule are not eligible for payment and will be denied as non-contracted.
Data Collection.  Each section contains multiple measures, which are further described herein. Unless otherwise stated, all data will be collected from the Hospital Compare website. For all measures herein, BCBST uses the CMS Hospital Compare definitions and specifications in effect at the time of data submission. Measurement will be collected by BCBST using Hospital Compare data available as of the reporting date specified in the hospital's P4P Addendum. Where there are not at least two measures within a section with available data to score, BCBST reserves the right to redistribute the weight for that section proportionally (according to the weights) to the other sections. For hospitals participating in the P4P Program, additional information, including timelines and any provider-specific information, is detailed in an addendum to the hospital's BCBST Provider Agreement (“P4P Addendum”).
MasterClauseData.MABH_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_p2: BCBST will not conduct any settlement or retroactive pricing or payment adjustments with Provider based on any changes, rebasing, adjustments, or outcomes of appeals related to any of Provider's rates set by CMS.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Payment_Policies_Section_: Drugs shown on the Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule and associated with Not Otherwise Classified (“NOC”) or Unlisted/Miscellaneous/Non-Specific HCPCS Codes or with no established fee shown will be manually priced in accordance with BCBST’s policy for Unlisted, Miscellaneous, Non-Specific and Not Otherwise Classified Procedures/Services, but may not be eligible for payment.  Such drugs must be billed with a unit of one (1) and require submission of: (i) drug name; (ii) National Drug Code (“NDC”) in field 43 “Revenue Description/ IDE/ Medicaid Drug Rebate” on the CMS-1450 claim form; and (iii) dosage administered. Failure to submit this information will result in delay of reimbursement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Scoring_Section_14.6.h._p6: Patient and Caregiver-Centered Experience of Care/Care Coordination (10%)
MasterClauseData.MABH_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_p1: Rate Updates. Rates under the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule are equivalent to amounts that would have been payable under Original Medicare for the same services; provided, however, that BCBST updates its BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule in the timeframes described in the Provider Manual. No retroactive adjustments will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS's release of a rate and BCBST's implementation of such rate or due to CMS's retroactive implementation of an amended rate.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Payment_Policies_Section_: Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule. BCBST will reimburse acute care hospitals for outpatient drugs listed in the Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule, in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for BCBST Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule contained in the Provider Manual. Eligible drugs will be reimbursed in addition to other outpatient services filed on the CMS-1450 (UB-04 or successor) claim form.
MasterClauseData.MABH_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_: Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program. Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Payment_Policies_Section_: Payment Hierarchy. BCBST will adhere to the following payment hierarchy for Outpatient Covered Services: (1) Outpatient Surgery procedures (2) all other. Except as otherwise set forth in this Attachment, BCBST will pay only the highest service in the hierarchy. All other services are considered included in the highest ranked service.
MasterClauseData.MABH_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_: Reimbursement Policies. In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Payment_Policies_Section_: All Other Outpatient Services.  All other Outpatient Services are those services that cannot otherwise be appropriately categorized for reimbursement in this Schedule 2 and that are approved for reimbursement by BCBST. The Revenue Codes listed in the Outpatient Payment Category Table will be considered for reimbursement unless performed in connection with an all-inclusive service.
MasterClauseData.MABH_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements. All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="MABH_Billing_Requirements" Title="MABH_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>CMS 1500 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Payment_Policies_Section_: Emergency Services.  In instances where a Member is admitted into an inpatient setting after treatment in the emergency room within 72 hours for related conditions, separate payment will not be made for the Emergency Services, and payment for the Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Rate Table will also represent payment for the Emergency Services.
MasterClauseData.MABH_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable. The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="MABH_Maximum_Allowable" Title="MABH_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>line level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Scoring_Section_14.6.h._p1: Scoring.  The P4P Program is divided into three sections, with scoring weighted as follows:
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Payment_Policies_Section_: Laboratory and Radiology Services.  The fee schedules (2-B, 2-C, 2D) referenced in this section are derived from the technical component of the Medicare RBRVS and the Medicare Clinical Laboratory Fee Schedule in effect as of January 1, 2019. Updates and deletions of codes will be in accordance with BCBST policies and procedures related to the addition/deletion of CPT® Codes as found in the Provider Manual. Codes in these categories that are not listed on the fee schedules are considered not contracted and are not reimbursable.
MasterClauseData.MABH_Definitions_Section_1: The following terms are defined for the purpose of this Attachment. All other capitalized terms have the same meaning as in the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Substitution_of_Quality_Measures_Sec: Substitution of Quality Measures.  The Parties recognize that the Quality Measures are all based on programs created and administered by third parties. On an annual basis, BCBST will evaluate the Quality Measures to ensure that the Quality Measures are still aligned with VBP and will provide written notice to Provider of changes to Quality Measures due to changes to VBP, which notice may be through a change to the Program Guide. In the event that any Quality Measure is no longer available or is no longer part of VBP, BCBST will, upon notice to Provider and in BCBST's reasonable discretion, substitute a different Quality Measure from those in use by VBP at that time, which will become a standard part of the P4P Program.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Payment_Policies_Section_: Observation Services.  Provider must obtain Prior Authorization in order to receive payment for Observation Services. In instances where a Member is admitted into an inpatient setting from observation status within 72 hours for related conditions, separate payment will not be made for the Observation Services, and payment for the Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Rate Table will also represent payment for the Observation Services.
MasterClauseData.MABH_Original_Medicare_Section_1.2: “Original Medicare” means the original entitlement Medicare Fee for Service program administered by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Relationship_to_ValueBased_Purchasin: Relationship to Value-Based Purchasing Program.  While the P4P Program does not apply to Provider's participation in Medicare Advantage networks, it is the Parties' intent that the Quality Measures in the P4P Program will be aligned with those in VBP. Each Quality Measure has been adopted by CMS as part of VBP; however, BCBST is under no obligation to adopt any particular portion of VBP as a Quality Measure. In the event that CMS discontinues VBP, BCBST will, upon notice to Provider and in BCBST's reasonable discretion, implement a substitute quality program that will apply to all hospitals that participate in the P4P Program and that will be based on objective, third-party measures. BCBST will use commercially reasonable efforts to select a substitute program that is similar in form and intent to VBP.
MasterClauseData.MABH_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Effect_on_Reimbursement_Section_14.6: If Provider reaches the maximum score under the P4P Program for the escalator to be implemented on June 1, 2020, Provider will receive an additional <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncrease" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncrease" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>1%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> escalator on June 1, <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncreaseeYear" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncreaseeYear" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XX<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Impatient_Dialysis_Section_3.2_p3: Outpatient dialysis is not eligible for payment under this Attachment
MasterClauseData.CPA_Effect_on_Reimbursement_Section_14.6: On June 1 in each of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncreaseeYear" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncreaseeYear" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XX<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> and <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncreaseeYear" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncreaseeYear" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XX<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>, all facilities under this Agreement will be eligible for an escalator of up to <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncrease" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncrease" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>four percent (4%)<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> based on performance under the P4P Program.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Surgery_Procedures_Sectio: When multiple surgical procedures are performed on the same day, the payment for the first procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACR_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Title="ACR_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment, the payment for the second procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACR_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Title="ACR_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>50%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment and the payment for the third procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACR_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Title="ACR_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>0%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>  of the Per Case payment. No additional payments will be made for procedures beyond the third procedure. When a procedure is repeated on the same day there will be no additional payment for the second procedure. Bilateral procedures will be paid in accordance with the Provider Manual.

Surgical Covered Services that are paid with the Outpatient Surgery Groups but that have not yet been assigned an Outpatient Surgery Group will appear on the Attachment 2-A and pay at the “Unlisted” rate until the annual recalibration process referenced in the Billing and Reimbursement Section of the Provider Manual, at which time the code will be moved to the appropriate Outpatient Surgery Group. These new assignments will automatically be made a part of Attachment 2-A, without any formal amendments thereto.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Effect_on_Reimbursement_Section_14.6: On [Insert Date], all facilities under this Agreement will be eligible for an escalator of up to three percent (3%) based on performance under the P4P Program.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Impatient_Dialysis_Section_3.2_p2: Inpatient dialysis must be billed with a Revenue Code in the range of 0801-0804. Payment will be denied for inpatient dialysis billed with any other Revenue Code.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Surgery_Procedures_Sectio: Outpatient Surgery Procedures.  Surgical Covered Services provided during an Outpatient Encounter will use the Per Case Payment Methodology. Surgical procedures will be paid according to the Outpatient Surgery Group to which BCBST assigns the procedure contained in Attachment 2-A.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Effect_on_Reimbursement_Section_14.6: On <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceReimbursementEffectiveDate" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceReimbursementEffectiveDate" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XX<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>, all facilities under this Agreement, with the exception of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceFacilityExceptions" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceFacilityExceptions" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XX<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>, will be eligible for an escalator of up to <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncrease" Title="CPA_PayforPerformanceEscalatorPercentIncrease" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>two percent (2%)<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> based on performance under the P4P Program.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Exclusions_Section_4.2_p2: Any items or services provided to Non-Patient Members
MasterClauseData.CPA_Effect_on_Reimbursement_Section_14.6: Effect on Reimbursement.  In addition to any fixed escalators agreed to by the Parties, Provider will be eligible to earn escalators based on its performance in the P4P Program as follows:
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Impatient_Dialysis_Section_3.2_p1: Inpatient Dialysis.  Payment for inpatient dialysis Covered Services is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="LTAC_Inpatient_Dialysis" Title="LTAC_Inpatient_Dialysis" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>$400.00<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> per treatment, which is payable in addition to the per diem rate for long-term acute care Covered Services. This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the inpatient dialysis services.
Aggregation of Measures.  Tennessee owned facilities will be measured in aggregate and will receive the same escalator.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Exclusions_Section_4.2_p1: Exclusions.  The following are specifically excluded from payment under this Attachment:
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Long_Term_Acute_Care_Services_Secti: Long-term acute care Covered Services must be billed with a Revenue Code in the range of 0100-0214.
Reporting Date.  The Reporting Date will be from January 1st through December 31st for each year that Provider participates in the P4P Program. For each Quality Measure, BCBST will collect the data that is available from the appropriate source as of the Reporting Date for use in calculating Provider's score under the P4P Program or otherwise described in this attachment. Parties agree to meet in good faith to discuss and/or resolve any reconciliation of data issues before rates are adjusted. If the parties are unable to resolve any reconciliation issues, then the parties will follow the dispute resolution provisions as set forth in Section 7 of the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Covered_Services_for_Outpatient_Sect: Covered Services for Outpatient. Outpatient Covered Services must be filed with the appropriate Revenue Code and/or CPT® Code/HCPCS Code on the institutional claim in order to be considered for payment.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Long_Term_Acute_Care_Services_Secti: With regard to any Member, the appropriate established fee, through the date of discharge, will be the one in effect as of the date of admission.
P4P Program Guide.  Unless otherwise stated herein, the P4P Program Guide contains the Quality Measures and scoring information for the P4P Program. The P4P Program Guide is hereby incorporated by reference in this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Exclusions_Section_3.3: Exclusions.  The following are specifically excluded from payment under this Attachment:
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Long_Term_Acute_Care_Services_Secti: Provider will be reimbursed for inpatient dialysis services as described herein. Customized wheelchairs must be billed by an appropriate, participating durable medical equipment (DME) provider. Professional services must be billed by an appropriate, participating professional provider.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.6.a._p5: “Value-Based Purchasing Program” or “VBP” means a Centers of Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) initiative that provides quality-based incentive payments to hospitals.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Exclusions_Section_3.3_a: Any Inpatient Covered Services not listed in Schedule 1.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.6.a._p4: “Reporting Date” means the date on which Quality Measure data must be available in order to be included in the scoring for P4P.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Acting_Contraceptives_fee_schedule_S: The Post-Partum Voluntary Reversible Long-Acting Contraceptives fee schedule (“VRLAC Fee Schedule”) is available to State of Tennessee Health Plan (“SEHP”) participants. Provider will be reimbursed at <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACR_VRLAC_Percent_Reimbursement" Title="ACR_VRLAC_Percent_Reimbursement" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the VRLAC Fee Schedule for Covered Services provided to SEHP participants in addition to the Inpatient Stay Payment Rate.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Inpatient_Rehabilitation_Section_3.2: Inpatient Rehabilitation.  Inpatient Rehabilitation must be billed separate from other services in the Inpatient Payment Category Table.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.6.a._p3: “Quality Measure” means an objective measurement of hospital quality that is used to score the P4P Program. The Quality Measures are described in the P4P Program Guide are divided into three categories: Patient Safety, Clinical Care, and Patient Experience of Clinical Care.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Other_Payment_Policies_Section_3.2_e: Other Payment Policies.  For information on BCBST's payment policies refer to the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Long_Term_Acute_Care_Services_Secti: The Per Diem rate is all-inclusive and will cover all supplies and services provided to a Member during the inpatient stay, with the following exceptions, which will be reimbursed as set forth below:
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.6.a._p2: “P4P Program Guide” means the program document titled “BlueCross BlueShield of Tennessee Hospital Pay-for-Performance Program Guide” that provides information on the P4P Program which is attached as an addendum to the Agreement.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Against_Medical_Advice_Discharges_Se: Against Medical Advice Discharges.  Inpatient Stays during which the Member left the Provider against medical advice will be reimbursable as referenced in the Inpatient Stay Payment Category Table or an Outlier payment, whichever is applicable.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Long_Term_Acute_Care_Services_Secti: Long Term Acute Care Services.  Payment for long-term acute care Covered Services is <# <TrackedContent TrackName="LTAC_Covered_Services_Per_Diem" Title="LTAC_Covered_Services_Per_Diem" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XX<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> Per Diem.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.6.a._p1: Definitions.  The following additional terms are defined for the purposes of this Section:
MasterClauseData.ACR_Expired_Patients_Section_3.2_c: Expired Patients.  An Inpatient Stay during which the Member expires will be treated as a normal discharge and reimbursable as referenced in the Inpatient Stay Payment Category Table or an Outlier payment, whichever is applicable.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4: Use Codes.  The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Ambulance_Services_Section_3.2_b: Ambulance Services.  Appropriate hospital-based ambulance services provided prior to an Inpatient Stay will be paid in addition to the applicable Payment Rate set forth in the Inpatient Payment Category Table and should be billed by the Provider as an outpatient service. Ambulance charges incurred while the patient is an inpatient are included in the applicable Payment Rate regardless of whether the ambulance provider is owned/operated by Provider or an Affiliate or an independent ambulance contractor. In instances where the ambulance provider is an independent ambulance contractor, ambulance services will be considered Covered Services furnished under arrangement.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
Verification.  Verification of the rate provisions set forth in this section shall be made annually utilizing mutually agreed upon procedures through an independent third party mutually agreed upon by the Parties.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Transfer_Payments_Section_3.2_a: Transfer Payments.  Transfers are considered normal admissions for the Receiving Hospital and are reimbursable as an Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Receiving Hospital's contract. The Transferring Hospital will receive the Transfer Per Diem in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Category Table above.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="LTAC_Billing_Requirements" Title="LTAC_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>CMS 1450 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
Compliance.  Provider shall work in good faith to take appropriate actions regarding its contracts with other Carriers to ensure that rates therein are in compliance with this section. If BCBST's rates are not Competitive Rates by January 1, 2016 Institution agrees to amend its rates with BCBST such that BCBST receives Competitive Rates.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Covered_Services_for_Inpatient_Secti: Covered Services for Inpatient.  Covered Services provided to a Member during an Inpatient Stay are payable as described in the Inpatient Payment Category Table. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, the Payment Rate for an Inpatient Stay is the Payment Rate in effect on the date the Inpatient Stay begins.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="LTAC_Maximum_Allowable" Title="LTAC_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>claim level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
Deletion.  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, BCBST, in its sole discretion, may amend this Agreement or the New Agreement to delete this section in its entirety with regard to any affected network upon written notice to Provider of such amendment.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Audit_Section_2.6: Audit.  BCBST may recover from Provider any amounts identified during an audit, pursuant to BCBSTs standard audit policy.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Revenue_Code_Section_1.3: “Revenue Code” means a hospital Revenue Code as adopted by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Competitive_Rate_Participation_Secti: Competitive Rate Participation.  Provider agrees that, during the Initial Term, its facilities' participation in Network S and Network P shall be at Competitive Rates. Furthermore, throughout the Initial Partnership Term, Provider agrees that it will not enter into any new agreements, or amend existing agreements, with any Carrier where such agreement would prevent BCBST from receiving Competitive Rates for one of these business segments unless Provider shall first notify BCBST prior to entering into such agreement or amendment, and BCBST shall have the opportunity to receive the same benefit as the new agreement or amendment.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Chargemaster_Protection_Section_2.5: Chargemaster Protection.  For those services paid at a POC, BCBST acknowledges that Provider may increase the charge values within its Chargemaster. Provider must provide BCBST with written notice of any changes to its Chargemaster <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACR_Prior_Written_Notice" Title="ACR_Prior_Written_Notice" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true" /> #>sixty (60) days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> prior to the effective date of such change(s). BCBST may, as appropriate, make adjustments to POC Payments to ensure the overall payment remains equivalent to the payments prior to the increase. BCBST will provide written notification to Provider of the adjustment to the rates paid at POC, and such adjustment will take effect in accordance with the written notification without a formal amendment to the Attachment. Without limiting any other audit rights of BCBST, BCBST has the right to audit Provider's records to assure compliance with this provision.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_Per_Diems_Section_1.2: “Per Diem(s)” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to Member for each day of an Inpatient Stay. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Diem payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member during each day of an Inpatient Stay including, but not limited to, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and room and board.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.5.a._p4: “New Entrant” means an insurance carrier that covers less than 5% of the covered lives for a particular business segment (e.g., ASO, fully-insured) in the GSA and has been licensed to sell health insurance products in the State of Tennessee for less than 3 years. New Entrants shall not include insurance carriers that are owned, controlled by, or under common ownership or control with any Carrier that does not fit within this definition.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4: Use of Codes.  The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.5.a._p3: “Carrier” means any insurer, producer, third-party administrator, HMO, hospital medical service corporation, etc. selling in the State of Tennessee. As used herein, “Carrier” shall not include: (i) self-pay patients; (ii) any Federal health care program, as defined at 42 U.S.C. § 1320a-7b(f); and (iii) any New Entrants (defined below) operating within the GSA; provided, however, that New Entrants may be reassessed every year and included in the definition of “Carrier” if at any time they no longer meet both criteria of the definition of New Entrant.
MasterClauseData.LTAC_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_p: Reimbursement Policies. In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program. Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.5.a._p2: “Competitive Rates” means the reimbursement rates paid by BCBST in effect on the Effective Date or at any time during the Initial Partnership Term, that are no more than zero to three percent (0-3%) higher than the lowest rates Provider accepts on an aggregate, allowable basis for comparable networks from any other Carrier (defined below) with whom Provider contracts.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Exclusions_Section_3.2: Exclusions. The following are specifically excluded under this Attachment:Services that are not covered by CMS under Original Medicare for inpatient rehabilitation services.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Definitions_Section_14.5.a._p1: Definitions. The following additional terms are defined for the purposes of this Section:
MasterClauseData.IPE_TBD_Section_3.1_p2: Prior authorization is required for all inpatient admissions. When obtaining the prior authorization for a patient on a ventilator, Provider must specify authorization is for a vent patient in order to receive the ventilator Per Diem.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACR_Billing_Requirements" Title="ACR_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true" /> #>CMS 1450 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Reprocessing_Claims_Section_14.4: Reprocessing Claims.  If any Network participation start date as set forth in this Agreement is prior to the Effective Date of the Agreement, the Parties agree that BCBST will reprocess all claims with dates of service on or after the Network participation start date in accordance with the most current rates in the corresponding Network Attachment that are part of this Agreement. If Provider has signed a new agreement with BCBST and claims are received prior to the new agreement being loaded into the BCBST system for processing, BCBST will reprocess those claims received using the new payment terms from the effective date of the new agreement.
MasterClauseData.IPE_TBD_Section_3.1_p1: The payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies, used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACR_Maximum_Allowable" Title="ACR_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true" /> #>claim level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Per_Diems_Section_1.9: “Per Diem(s)” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to Member for each day of an Inpatient Stay. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Diem payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member during each day of an Inpatient Stay including, but not limited to, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non- diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and room and board.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Inpatient_Rehabilitation_Services_Se: Prior authorization is required for all inpatient admissions.  When obtaining the prior authorization for a patient on a ventilator, Provider must specify authorization is for a vent patient in order to receive the ventilator Per Diem.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Per_Case_Section_1.8: “Per Case” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member during an Inpatient Stay or an Outpatient Encounter. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Case payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member including, but not limited to, Implants, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay or an Outpatient Encounter, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and room and board.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Inpatient_Rehabilitation_Services_Se: The payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies, used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Payment_Rates_Section_1.7: “Payment Rate(s)” means Maximum Allowable as defined in the Billing and Reimbursement Guidelines section below.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Third_Party_Acts_and_Omissions_Secti: Third Party. If, after good faith negotiations, the Parties cannot agree what the appropriate fee schedule adjustment should be, they shall mutually select an independent third party experienced in health care analytics to review an expanded sample of records and determine what adjustment should be made in the TRNM Amendment. The Parties further agree that the cost of any independent audit only will be split equally by both Parties. Each Party shall be solely responsible for their own costs and attorneys' fees associated with the independent audit.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Inpatient_Rehabilitation_Services_Se: Inpatient Rehabilitation Services.Payment for Inpatient Rehabilitation Covered Services is:
MasterClauseData.ACR_Payment_Methodology_Section_1.6: “Payment Methodology” means a methodology for determining Payment Rates in this attachment.
Implementation. The implementation of the rates in the TRNM Amendment shall occur no sooner than <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_ImplementationNoSoonerThan" Title="CPA_ImplementationNoSoonerThan" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>thirty (30) days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> and no later than <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_ImplementationNoLaterThan" Title="CPA_ImplementationNoLaterThan" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>sixty (60) days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> after the Parties have executed the TRNM Amendment.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Inpatient_Rehabilitation_Services_Se: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Outpatient_Surgery_Group_Section_1.5: “Outpatient Surgery Group” means the group to which an outpatient surgical procedure code is assigned based on expected use of resources. This does not include any outpatient surgical procedures specifically carved out in this attachment.
Adjustments. The TRNM Amendment shall include such rate adjustments as are necessary to provide TRNM transition related budget neutrality (the “TRNM Budget Neutral Adjustments”) but shall not provide budget neutrality for any other reason, such as case mix or volume changes, easonal adjustments, additional facility acquisitions or employer group changes. In addition to the TRNM Budget Neutral Adjustments, the TRNM Amendment shall include a further temporary adjustment to neutralize the effect of TRNM transition not being neutral from the Transition Date until the date the TRNM Budget Neutral Adjustments are implemented.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Inpatient_Rehabilitation_Services_Se: <# <TrackedContent TrackName="IPE_Percent_of_BCBST_Medicare_Fee_Schedule" Title="IPE_Percent_of_BCBST_Medicare_Fee_Schedule" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule
MasterClauseData.ACR_Implants_Section_1.4: “Implant(s)” means a Surgical Implant or a Surgical Appliance.
Notice. If either Party believes that TNRM transition has not been Budget Neutral, it shall notify the other Party no sooner than <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_NoticeNoSoonerThan" Title="CPA_NoticeNoSoonerThan" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>twelve (12) months<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> and no later than <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_NoticeNoLaterThan" Title="CPA_NoticeNoLaterThan" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>eighteen (18) months<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> after the Transition Date. The Parties shall work together in good faith to determine the financial impact of TRNM transition, and, if they agree the transition has not been Budget Neutral, shall make a one-time amendment (“TRNM Amendment”) to the affected Network Attachments for the sole purpose of adjusting the fees associated with the affected Networks to ensure budget neutrality on a going-forward basis. No retroactive claim adjustments will occur solely as a result of the TRNM Amendment. Without limiting the foregoing, good faith shall require the notifying Party to disclose to the other Party the data and process it used to determine that TRNM transition was not Budget Neutral.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Inpatient_Rehabilitation_Services_Se: Inpatient Rehabilitation Services. Payment for inpatient rehabilitation Covered Services is:
MasterClauseData.ACR_HCPCS_Code_Section_1.3: “HCPCS Code” means Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System based on the AMA's Current Procedural Terminology (“CPT®”) and updated by CMS.
Difference. The Parties agree that Budget Neutrality will be achieved if the difference between (a) and (b) is within a range of plus or minus <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_BudgetNeutralAggregateRange" Title="CPA_BudgetNeutralAggregateRange" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000.00)<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> in aggregate across all acute care facilities as set forth on Exhibit 1A contracted under this Agreement for both Network P and Network S combined as of the Transition Date.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.5: Use of Codes. The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.ACR_CPT_Codes_Section_1.2: “CPT® Code(s)” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Calculation_Section_14.10.a._p3: Rates in effect on and after the Transition Date.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Rate_Codes_Section_2.4_p2: BCBST will not conduct any settlement or retroactive pricing or payment adjustments with Provider based on any changes, rebasing, adjustments, or outcomes of appeals related to any of Provider’s Medicare cost reports that impact or would have impacted the rates set by CMS for Provider.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Transferring_Hospital_Section_1.17: “Transferring Hospital” means the hospital that initially admits and subsequently transfers a Member to a Receiving Hospital.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Calculation_Section_14.10.a._p2: Rates in effect immediately prior to the Transition Date; and
MasterClauseData.IPE_Rate_Codes_Section_2.4_p1: Rate Updates.  Rates under the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule are equivalent to amounts that would have been payable under Original Medicare to Provider for the same services; provided however, that BCBST updates its BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule in the timeframes described in the Provider Manual.  No retroactive adjustments will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS’s release of a rate and BCBST’s implementation of such rate in accordance with the Provider Manual or due to CMS’s retroactive implementation of an amended rate.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Transfers_Section_1.16: “Transfer(s)” means instances in which a Member is transferred from a Transferring Hospital to a Receiving Hospital for treatment.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Calculation_Section_14.10.a._p1: Calculation. Budget Neutrality will be calculated based on the allowed amount for the Transition Claims under each of the following:
MasterClauseData.IPE_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_m: Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program. Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Surgical_Implant_Section_1.15: “Surgical Implant” means a device that is Medically Necessary that is surgically placed internally for therapeutic or reconstructive purposes and not considered a prosthetic or orthotic device.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_m: Reimbursement Policies. In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Surgical_Appliance_Section_1.14: “Surgical Appliance” means a surgical device that is Medically Necessary that is externally placed as a part of a surgical procedure and is integral to the surgical procedure and not considered a prosthetic or orthotic device.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Headings_Section_13.9: Headings.  The headings of articles and sections contained in this Agreement are for reference purposes only, will not be deemed to be a part of this Agreement for any purpose, and will not in any way define or affect the meaning, interpretation, construction, or scope of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.IPE_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3: Reimbursement Policies. In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Revenue_Codes_Section_1.13: “Revenue Code(s)” means a hospital Revenue Code as adopted by CMS.
Written Amendments.  Except as otherwise provided in this Section, this Agreement, or any part, article, section, exhibit, or Network Attachment(s) hereto, may be amended, altered, or modified only in a writing duly executed by both Parties.

If Provider notifies BCBST in writing within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_ProviderManualDeemerPeriod" Title="CPA_ProviderManualDeemerPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> after notice of the amendment that Provider does not accept the proposed amendment, such amendment will not take effect and BCBST will have the right to elect either (i) to have this Agreement remain in effect in accordance with its terms without the proposed amendment or (ii) to terminate this Agreement by giving written notice not less than <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_ProviderManualTermNotice" Title="CPA_ProviderManualTermNotice" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>15 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> prior to the effective date of termination.

All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.

Provider will have <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_ProviderManualDeemerPeriod" Title="CPA_ProviderManualDeemerPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> after notice of the amendment in which to respond in writing to BCBST. If Provider either accepts such amendment or fails to respond in writing within such period, the proposed amendment will be deemed accepted by Provider and will become effective, and therefore binding on Provider and BCBST, upon the earlier of Provider's written acceptance or the expiration of such <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_ProviderManualDeemerPeriod" Title="CPA_ProviderManualDeemerPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30 day<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> period; and

Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Diem payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member during each day of an Inpatient Stay including, but not limited to, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, nursing care, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and room and board.

BCBST will furnish Provider with the proposed amendment in writing;
MasterClauseData.IPE_Original_Medicare_Section_1.2: “Original Medicare” means the original entitlement Medicare Fee for Service program administered by CMS.
MasterClauseData.ACR_Chargemaster_Section_1.1: “Chargemaster” means Provider's comprehensive listing of items and services billable by Provider and Provider's associated charges for such items and services.
Amending the Agreement.  BCBST will have the right to amend this Agreement in accordance with the following procedure:
MasterClauseData.IPE_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Incorporation_of_Certain_Changes_Sec: Incorporation of Certain Changes.  The removal of a Network Provider from a Network, or a change (i) to a Blue Cross Benefit Plan, (ii) to BCBST policies or procedures, or (iii) required by state or federal laws and regulations, will be automatically incorporated herein to the extent the services rendered by Provider pursuant to this Agreement are affected by such removal or change.
Blue Cross Benefit Plans.  BCBST retains the right to change, revise, modify, or alter the terms of any Blue Cross Benefit Plan issued or administered by BCBST without prior approval or notice to Provider.
MasterClauseData.IOBH_Other_Outpatient_Behavioral_Health_: Other Outpatient Behavioral Health Services. Other outpatient behavioral health Covered Services will be reimbursed on a Per Visit basis at the rates below:
Provider Manual.  The terms and conditions of the Provider Manual are incorporated into, and made a part of, this Agreement by this reference. Unless expressly stated otherwise, if a conflict arises between this Agreement and the Provider Manual, the terms and conditions of the Provider Manual will prevail. BCBST retains the right to change, revise, modify, or alter the terms of the Provider Manual upon at least 30 days' prior written notice to Provider unless a longer notice period is required by law.
MasterClauseData.IOBH_Observation_Services_Section_3.5: Observation Services. Provider must obtain Prior Authorization in order to receive payment for Observation Services. In instances where a Member is admitted directly from observation status, separate payment will not be made for the Observation Services, and payment for inpatient behavioral health Covered Services in accordance with this Attachment will also represent payment for the Observation Services. Observation Service rates shown in this section are all-inclusive and will fully compensate Provider for all Covered Services provided in association with Observation Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Entire_Agreement_Section_13.7: Entire Agreement.  This Agreement, together with the applicable Provider Manual, other manuals provided to Provider via the BCBST website or in hard copy format, and exhibits, schedules, and attachments, constitutes the entire Agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements and undertakings, whether oral or written. In the event that an earlier executed agreement exists between the Parties regarding Provider's participation in the Networks included in this Agreement for the items and services eligible for payment under this Agreement, this Agreement will supersede such earlier agreement with regard to such Networks and such items and services as of the first day of the Fixed Term, or, if different, the first day of the Network-specific Fixed Term. This Agreement will remain in full force and effect with respect to all Members, unless otherwise expressly stated.
MasterClauseData.IOBH_Partial_Hospitalization_Section_3.4: Partial Hospitalization.  The Per Visit amounts below are all-inclusive and will fully reimburse Provider for all services provided to the Member on the date of service, including, but not limited to facility, ancillary, diagnostic, professional (including physician) and clinical services and supplies.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Severability_Section_13.6_p2: In such event that a provision of this Agreement is rendered invalid or unenforceable or declared null and void as provided above, and its removal has the effect of materially altering the obligations of a Party in such manner as (i) will cause serious financial hardship to such Party; or (ii) will cause such Party to act in violation of its corporate articles or bylaws, the Party so affected will have the right to terminate this Agreement upon 30 days' prior written notice to the other Party.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Severability_Section_13.6_p1: Severability.  In the event that any part of any provision of this Agreement is rendered invalid or unenforceable under applicable law, or is declared null and void by any court of competent jurisdiction, such part will be ineffective to the extent of such invalidity or unenforceability only, without in any way affecting the remaining parts of such provision or the remaining parts of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.IOBH_Intensive_Outpatient_Behavioral_Hea: In the event that a Member is assessed for inclusion in intensive outpatient behavioral health Covered Services and not admitted into an intensive outpatient program, BCBST will reimburse the physician who rendered the assessment directly. Otherwise, reimbursement for initial assessments is included in the Per Visit amount.

Such claim will be paid in accordance with the professional provider agreement between BCBST and the physician, or, if no such agreement exists, under BCBST payment rules for out-of-network services.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Waiver_of_Breach_Section_13.4: Waiver of Breach.  Neither the waiver by either of the Parties of a breach of, or a default under, any of the provisions of this Agreement, nor the failure of either of the Parties, on one or more occasions, to enforce any of the provisions of this Agreement, or to exercise any right or privilege hereunder, will be construed as a waiver of any subsequent breach or default of a similar nature, or as a waiver of any such provisions, rights, or privileges hereunder.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Subcontracting_Section_13.3: Subcontracting.  Provider will not subcontract this Agreement, or any portion of this Agreement, without the prior written consent of BCBST, which consent may be withheld by BCBST for any reason. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, BCBST may subcontract any administrative function as it relates to this Agreement to any organization it so designates. In addition, in the absence of a separate agreement with any entity referenced in this section, the terms of this Agreement or any Network Attachment(s) will be applicable to any services provided to individuals covered under healthcare plans insured or administered by any entity or its Affiliates that is licensed by the BCBSA to use the BCBS Marks.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Expansion_Section_13.2: Expansion.  Provider may add services, other Associated Providers, additional locations, change billing practices, or they may acquire or be acquired by, merge with, or otherwise become affiliated with another provider of health care services (Expansion).  If BCBST reasonably determines that any Expansion has or will have a detrimental financial impact to BCBST, the Parties agree to meet in good faith regarding such change within 90 days of a request by BCBST.  The purpose of such meeting will be to discuss the Expansion and negotiate in good faith to revise the rates under this Agreement to account for the detrimental financial impact to BCBST.  If the parties do not agree to revised rates within 60 days of the meeting described herein, BCBST may at its discretion terminate the Agreement with <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_ExpansionDaysNotice" Title="CPA_ExpansionDaysNotice" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>60 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> days prior notice.

A scanned, imaged, electronic, photocopy or stamp of the signatures hereunder will have the same force and effect as an originally executed signature.

With the exception of those services specifically enumerated below, the established fee will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACAM_Network_MA_PPO_Acute_Care_Inpatient_Percent" Title="ACAM_Network_MA_PPO_Acute_Care_Inpatient_Percent" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XXX%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule for acute care inpatient services and <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACAM_Network_MA_PPO_Acute_Care_Outpatient_Percent" Title="ACAM_Network_MA_PPO_Acute_Care_Outpatient_Percent" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>XXX%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule for acute care outpatient services. The payment noted above does not include payment for capital indirect medical education ("IME"), disproportionate share hospital ("DSH") payments, or any uncompensated care payments ("UCP"). Provider understands and agrees that: (1) there will be no payment for such capital IME, DSH or UCP costs from BCBST; and (2) operating IME is specifically excluded from payments from Medicare Advantage Organizations, and it is Provider's responsibility to seek reimbursement for operating IME directly from CMS.

No retroactive adjustments will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS's release of a rate and BCBST's implementation of such rate in accordance with the Provider Manual or due to CMS's retroactive implementation of an amended rate.
MasterClauseData.ACAM_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_: Regardless of any other provision in the Agreement, inclusive of this Attachment, to the contrary, Provider understands and agrees that claims, data and other payment information may be used by BCBST or the applicable Payor for purposes of obtaining payments under a federal health care program. Should payments to managed care organizations participating in federal health care programs, such as BCBST or the applicable Payor, be adjusted other than through the payment methodology for the applicable federal health care program, BCBST or the applicable Payor may implement the same or a similar adjustment to payment rates and/or payments for Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Assignment_Change_of_Control_Section: BCBST may assign this Agreement to any of its Affiliates without Provider's prior written consent. Any assignment or attempt to do the same that is in violation of this section will be void and will have no binding effect. This Agreement will be binding on, and inure to the benefit of, the Parties to this Agreement and their respective successors and permitted assigns.
MasterClauseData.IOBH_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="IOBH_Billing_Requirements_CMS_1450_form" Title="IOBH_Billing_Requirements_CMS_1450_form" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>CMS 1450 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.ACAM_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3_: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.IOBH_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1_p2: Reimbursement for behavioral health services is based on the level of care provided and the age of the Member. Definitions of the age ranges included herein are included in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Assignment_Change_of_Control_Section: Assignment; Change of Control.  This Agreement will not in any manner be assigned by Provider, including to any successor-in-interest or by operation of law, without the prior written consent of BCBST, which consent may be withheld by BCBST for any reason. Provider must notify BCBST in writing at least 60 days prior to the effective date of any Change of Control affecting Provider and BCBST, at its discretion, may terminate this Agreement by providing Provider written notice no later than 60 days after receiving Provider's notice of the Change of Control.
MasterClauseData.ACAM_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACAM_Billing_Requirements" Title="ACAM_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>CMS 1450 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.IOBH_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1_p1: Maximum Allowable. The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="IOBH_Maximum_Allowable_Claim_Level" Title="IOBH_Maximum_Allowable_Claim_Level" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>claim level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual.  All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.ACAM_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACAM_Maximum_Allowable" Title="ACAM_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>claim level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>, as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.IOBH_Revenue_Code_Section_1.5: “Revenue Code” means a hospital Revenue Code as adopted by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Right_of_Termination_Section_12.2: Right of Termination.  In the event that the Covered Services to be provided by Provider are substantially interrupted so that Provider cannot adequately render quality healthcare due to the events described in the “Unforeseen Circumstance” provision in this Agreement, for a period of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_RightOfTerminationInterruptionPeriod" Title="CPA_RightOfTerminationInterruptionPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>60 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>, BCBST will have the right to terminate this Agreement upon <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_RightOfTerminationInterruptionNotice" Title="CPA_RightOfTerminationInterruptionNotice" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30 days'<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> prior Notice to Provider.
MasterClauseData.ACAM_Original_Medicare_Section_1.2: “Original Medicare” means the original entitlement Medicare Fee for Service program administered by CMS.
MasterClauseData.IOBH_Per_Visit_Section_1.4: “Per Visit” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member on a one (1) calendar day period, for each type of service for which a Per Visit payment is indicated in this Attachment. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Visit payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member including, but not limited to, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay or an Outpatient Encounter, nursing care, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and institution and ancillary services. Provider is required to identify each date of service when submitting claims that span multiple dates of service.
Unforeseen Circumstances.  In the event that Provider's operations are interrupted by acts of war, fire, terrorism, insurrection, labor disputes, riots, earthquakes, or other acts of nature beyond its reasonable control, Provider will be relieved of its obligation to perform any services that are affected, such that it could not render quality healthcare to any Member.
MasterClauseData.ACAM_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.IOBH_Per_Diem_Section_1.3: “Per Diem(s)” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to Member for each day of an Inpatient Stay. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Diem payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member during each day of an Inpatient Stay including, but not limited to, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay, nursing care, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and room and board.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Survival_Section_11.9_prov: Survival.  It is the express intention and agreement of the Parties that “Disputes”, “Payment Dispute Resolution”, “Reimbursement”, “Overpayments or Underpayments”, “Subrogation and Right to Recover”, “Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits”, “Resolution of Disputes”,  “Records, Access, Inspection and Confidentiality”, “Liability and Indemnification”, “Effects of Termination”, “Cooperation Upon Termination”, “No Interference”, and “Non-Disparagement” provisions in this Agreement and all other sections which by their terms are intended to survive termination, or which are necessary for the resolution of all matters unresolved, will survive any termination of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.IOBH_Observation_Services_Section_1.2: “Observation Services” means the use of a bed and periodic monitoring by Provider's nursing staff, which is reasonable and necessary to evaluate a Member's condition.
MasterClauseData.IOBH_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Survival_Section_11.9_prof: Survival.  It is the express intention and agreement of the Parties that “Disputes”, “Payment Dispute Resolution”, “Reimbursement”, “Overpayments or Underpayments”, “Subrogation and Right to Recover”, “Coordination/Maintenance of Benefits”, “Resolution of Disputes”,  “Records, Access, Inspection and Confidentiality”, “Liability and Indemnification”, “Effects of Termination”, “Termination or Exclusion of Associated Providers”, “Cooperation Upon Termination”, “No Interference”, and “Non-Disparagement” provisions in this Agreement and all other sections which by their terms are intended to survive termination, or which are necessary for the resolution of all matters unresolved, will survive any termination of this Agreement.

MasterClauseData.CPA_Cooperation_Upon_Termination_No_Inte: Cooperation Upon Termination; No Interference; Non-Disparagement.  The Parties agree to cooperate with each other to resolve promptly any outstanding financial, administrative, or patient care issues upon the termination of this Agreement. The Parties further agree to work together in good faith to provide timely and appropriate notice to Members of the anticipated termination date of this Agreement. Provider agrees to assist Members who are under the care of Provider or who have scheduled Covered Services to be provided after the anticipated termination date, in transitioning to another Network Provider. Provider further agrees to promptly supply all records and documents necessary for the settlement of outstanding claims for Covered Services upon the termination of the Agreement. Provider also agrees to refrain in every instance from interfering with the contractual relationship between BCBST and its Members or to discourage any person from doing business with BCBST. Finally, both Parties agree not to make any statements, written or verbal, or cause or encourage others to make any statements, written or verbal, that defame, disparage, or in any way criticize the personal or business reputation, practices, or conduct of the other party, its employees, directors, and officers. The Parties acknowledge and agree that this prohibition extends to statements, written or verbal, made to anyone, including but not limited to, the news media, investors, potential investors, any board of directors or advisory board or directors, industry analysts, competitors, strategic partners, vendors, employees (past and present), and clients.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Separtely_Reimbursed_Drug_Fee_Schedu: The Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule will be updated in accordance with the Reimbursement Policy and Billing Guidelines for the BCBST Separately Reimbursed Drug Fee Schedule.
MasterClauseData.IRL_Reference_Laboratory_Services_Sectio: Reference Laboratory Services.  Payment for reference laboratory Covered Services is:
MasterClauseData.CPA_Effects_of_Termination_Section_11.7: Effects of Termination.  The termination of this Agreement will not release Provider, except as otherwise determined by BCBST, from any obligation to provide Covered Services to a Member who is being treated by Provider until the Member is transferred to the care of another Network Provider. BCBST will make payments to Provider for such Covered Services in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. Upon termination of this Agreement, the Parties will cooperate with each other to affect such orderly transfer as promptly as is medically practicable and appropriate. BCBST will continue to have access to records of Members, for a period of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_TerminationRecordAccessPeriod" Title="CPA_TerminationRecordAccessPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>5 years<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> after termination of this Agreement, or <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_TerminationRecordAccessBenefitPlanPeriod" Title="CPA_TerminationRecordAccessBenefitPlanPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>10 years<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> in the case of Members whose Blue Cross Benefit Plan was purchased through the federal health insurance exchange, or as otherwise required by law and as necessary to fulfill the terms of this Agreement and any specific terms applicable to a Network. In addition, in cases of suspected fraud or abuse, BCBST will continue to have access to records until all matters relating to such fraud and abuse have been resolved. The Parties agree that money damages may not be a sufficient remedy for any breach of this Agreement. The non-breaching Party, at its option, will be entitled to terminate this Agreement, to specific performance, and to injunctive relief, in addition to any other remedies available at law or in equity, upon the breach or threatened breach of this Agreement.
MasterClauseData.IRL_Indepent_Laboratory_Services_Section: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies, used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Other_Termination_Section_11.6: Other Termination.  In addition to the termination rights under the “Term; Termination” provisions, either Party may terminate this Agreement in accordance with the terms of the “Right of Termination” or the “Severability” provisions in this Agreement. BCBST may also terminate this Agreement in accordance with the terms of the “Assignment”, “Change of Control”, “Provider Manual”, or “Amendments”  provisions in this Agreement.

Such drugs must be billed with a unit of one (1) and require submission of: (i) drug name; (ii) National Drug Code ("NDC") in field 43 "Revenue Description/ IDE/ Medicaid Drug Rebate" on the CMS-1450 claim form; and (iii) dosage administered. Failure to submit this information will result in delay of reimbursement.

All other Outpatient Services are those services that cannot otherwise be appropriately categorized for reimbursement in this Schedule 2 and that are approved for reimbursement by BCBST. The Revenue Codes listed in the All Other Outpatient Services Section E of the Provider Manual will be considered for reimbursement unless performed in connection with an all-inclusive service.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Services_under_the_BCBST_Base_Fee_Sc: Services under the BCBST Base Fee Schedules. Services listed in the BCBST Base Fee Schedule (2-G) are derived from the technical component of the RBRVS Fee Schedule in effect as of January 1, 2019. Updates and deletions of codes on the BCBST Base Fee Schedule will be made in accordance with BCBST policies and procedures related to the addition/deletion of CPT® Codes as found in the Provider Manual.

MasterClauseData.ACA_Payment_Hierarchy_Section_4.5_d: Payment Hierarchy. BCBST will adhere to the following payment hierarchy for outpatient Covered Services: (1) Per Case services (2) Per Visit services (3) all other. Except as otherwise set forth in this Attachment, BCBST will pay only the highest service type in the hierarchy. All other services are considered included in the highest ranked service.

MasterClauseData.ACA_Emergency_Services_Section_4.5_c: Emergency Services. In instances where a Member is admitted into an inpatient setting after treatment in the emergency room within 72 hours for related conditions, separate payment will not be made for the Emergency Services, and payment for the Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Rate Table will also represent payment for the Emergency Services.

The fee schedules (2-B, 2-C, 2D) referenced in this section are derived from the technical component of the Medicare RBRVS and the Medicare Clinical Laboratory Fee Schedule in effect as of January 1, 2019. Updates and deletions of codes will be in accordance with BCBST policies and procedures related to the addition/deletion of CPT® Codes as found in the Provider Manual. Codes in these categories that are not listed on the fee schedules are considered not contracted and are not reimbursable.
MasterClauseData.CPA_BCBST_Immediate_Termination_Section_: BCBST Immediate Termination. BCBST may, immediately on written notice, terminate this Agreement with regard to Provider or may exclude an Associated Provider or Entity from participation under this Agreement in the event that:
MasterClauseData.IRL_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.5: Use of Codes.  The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Observation_Services_Section_4.5_a: Observation Services. Provider must obtain Prior Authorization in order to receive payment for Observation Services. In instances where a Member is admitted into an inpatient setting from observation status within 72 hours for related conditions, separate payment will not be made for the Observation Services, and payment for the Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Rate Table will also represent payment for the Observation Services.
MasterClauseData.IRL_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_lab_p2: For new codes or codes for which CMS does not publish a fee or methodology (i.e., codes other than those with status code “A”), reimbursement will be based on a reasonable allowable determined by BCBST, as described in the Provider Manual. In the event that CMS publishes a fee for a code for which it did not previously publish a fee, BCBST will implement such fee within a reasonable amount of time after publication.
MasterClauseData.CPA_BCBST_Immediate_Termination_Section_: Power to direct the management of BCBST becomes controlled by an entity not controlled by BCBST, or BCBST converts to a for-profit entity.
MasterClauseData.IRL_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_lab_p1: Rate Updates.  Fee amounts set forth in the BCBST Base Independent Laboratory Fee Schedule are based on current year Medicare rates. BCBST implements updates to Medicare-based rates on April 1 of each year. Services provided between January 1 and March 31 will be reimbursed based on the previous year's Medicare rates.
MasterClauseData.CPA_BCBST_Immediate_Termination_Section_: Cannot be paid via EFT in accordance with the “EFT” provision in this Agreement; or
MasterClauseData.ACA_Outpatient_Surgery_Procedures_Sectio: When multiple surgical procedures are performed on the same day, the payment for the first procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACA_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Title="ACA_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_first_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment, the payment for the second procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACA_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Title="ACA_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_second_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>50%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment and the payment for the third procedure will be <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACA_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Title="ACA_Multiple_surgical_procedures_same_day_third_procedure" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>0%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the Per Case payment. No additional payments will be made for procedures beyond the third procedure. When a procedure is repeated on the same day there will be no additional payment for the second procedure. Bilateral procedures will be paid in accordance with the Provider Manual.
