MasterClauseData.IRL_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_p2: BCBST will not conduct any settlement or retroactive pricing or payment adjustments with Provider based on any changes, rebasing, adjustments, or outcomes of appeals related to any of Provider's rates set by CMS.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Outpatient_Surgery_Procedures_Sectio: Surgical Covered Services that are paid with the Outpatient Surgery Groups but that have not yet been assigned an Outpatient Surgery Group will appear on the Attachment 2-A and pay at the "Unlisted" rate until the annual recalibration process referenced in the Billing and Reimbursement Section E of the Provider Manual, at which time the code will be moved to the appropriate Outpatient Surgery Group. These new assignments will automatically be made a part of Attachment 2-A without any formal amendments thereto.
MasterClauseData.IRL_Rate_Updates_Section_2.4_p1: Rate Updates.  Rates under the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule are equivalent to amounts that would have been payable under Original Medicare to Provider for the same services; provided however, that BCBST updates the BCBST Medicare Fee Schedule in the timeframes described in the Provider Manual. No retroactive adjustment will be made, whether due to the interval between CMS's release of a rate and BCBST's implementation of such rate in accordance with the Provider Manual or due to CMS's retroactive implementation of an amended rate.

MasterClauseData.ACA_Outpatient_Surgery_Procedures_Sectio: Outpatient Surgery Procedures. Surgical Covered Services provided during an Outpatient Encounter will use the Per Case Payment Methodology. MasterClauseData.CPA_Material_Breach_Section_11.3: Material Breach.  This Agreement or participation in a specific Network may be terminated by either Party by giving <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_MaterialBreachTerminationNotice" Title="CPA_MaterialBreachTerminationNotice" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>30 days'<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> prior Notice to the other Party if the Party to whom notice is given is in material breach of any provisions of this Agreement. The Party claiming the right to terminate will set forth in the notice, the facts underlying the claim that the other is in breach of this Agreement. Remedy of the breach to the satisfaction of the Party giving notice, within 30 days of notice, will nullify the intended termination notice. However, if BCBST becomes aware, in its reasonable judgment, of a pattern of activity or practice of Provider that constitutes multiple material breaches under this Agreement, BCBST may terminate this Agreement and Provider's participation in all Networks pursuant to this Agreement immediately by providing Provider with written notice of such termination.
MasterClauseData.HOS_Hospice_Services_Section_3.1_p3: This payment is all-inclusive, including without limitation all services, equipment, and/or supplies, used in conjunction with the services.
MasterClauseData.ACA_The_PPV_Reversible_LAC_fee_schedule_: The Post-Partum Voluntary Reversible Long-Acting Contraceptives fee schedule ("VRLAC Fee Schedule") is available to State of Tennessee Health Plan ("SEHP") participants. Provider will be reimbursed at <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACA_VRLAC_Percent_Reimbursement" Title="ACA_VRLAC_Percent_Reimbursement" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of theVRLAC Fee Schedule for Covered Services provided to SEHP participants in addition to the Inpatient Stay Payment Rate.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Without_Cause_Termination_Section_11: Without Cause Termination.  Neither Party may terminate this Agreement without cause during the Fixed Period. Thereafter, either Party may terminate this Agreement or Provider's participation in a Network by giving Notice to the other Party no later than <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_WithoutCauseTerminationNotice" Title="CPA_WithoutCauseTerminationNotice" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true" /> #>120 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> prior to <# <Content Select="//WithoutCauseTermination" Optional="true" /> #> which will become the effective date of the termination.
MasterClauseData.HOS_Hospice_Services_Section_3.1_p2: <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HOS_Hospice_Covered_Services" Title="HOS_Hospice_Covered_Services" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>100%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the current highest Tennessee published CMS Medicare Rate. BCBST implements updates to Medicare based rates on April 1 of each year. Services provided between January 1 and March 31 will be reimbursed based on the previous year's Medicare rates.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Termination_or_Exclusion_of_an_Entit: Termination or Exclusion of an Entity.  In the event that BCBST excludes an Entity from participation under this Agreement for cause or terminates a direct contract between BCBST and an Entity for cause, such Entity will no longer be permitted to participate under this Agreement. Provider will submit any claims for such Entity with the Entity's NPI number. If BCBST determines Provider has been submitting claims for services rendered by the terminated or excluded Entity in such a way that it appears services were rendered by a Network Provider, BCBST may terminate this Agreement for cause.
MasterClauseData.ACA_MSDRG_795_Section_3.2_g: MS-DRG 795 will be considered for reimbursement when: (1) Baby is in the hospital due to medical necessity after mom has been discharged. (2) Baby is re-admitted to the hospital due to medical necessity. (3) The Member's contract is individual for dad and (a) mom has no insurance or (b) mom has insurance with another insurance carrier and the baby is not covered.
MasterClauseData.HOS_Hospice_Services_Section_3.1_p1: Hospice Services.  Payment for hospice Covered Services is:
MasterClauseData.ACA_Inpatient_Rehabilitation_Section_3.2: Inpatient Rehabilitation.  Inpatient Rehabilitation must be billed separate from other services in the Inpatient Payment Category Table.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Termination_or_Exclusion_of_Associat: Termination or Exclusion of Associated Provider. In the event that BCBST excludes an Associated Provider from participation under this Agreement for cause or terminates a direct contract between BCBST and an Associated Provider for cause, such Associated Provider will no longer be permitted to participate under this Agreement. Provider will be responsible for notifying Members who present to Provider for treatment that the affected Associated Provider is not participating with BCBST. Provider will submit any claims for such Associated Provider with the Associated Provider's NPI number. If BCBST determines that Provider has been submitting claims for services rendered by the terminated or excluded Associated Provider in such a way that it appears such services were rendered by a Network Provider, BCBST may terminate this Agreement for cause.
MasterClauseData.HOS_Use_Of_Codes_Section_2.4: Use of Codes.  The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Other_Payment_Policies_Section_3.2_e: Other Payment Policies.  For information on BCBST's DRG payment policies, including but not limited to mother and newborn payments, ungroupable DRGs, pre-admission services, private room differentials, kidney transplants, and conditions present on admission, refer to the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Term_Section_11.1: Term.  This Agreement will be in effect for a fixed period (the “Fixed Period”) of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_AgreementInitialPeriod" Title="CPA_AgreementInitialPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>3 years<# <EndTrackedContent/> #>, beginning on the Effective Date and continuing through and including; thereafter, this Agreement will continue in effect, unless and until terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. The Fixed Period and any renewal period may be referred to as the “Term” of this Agreement. Provider's participation in specific Networks will become effective as of the date noted for the applicable Network, and will remain in effect until terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. In the event this Agreement terminates, participation in all Networks pursuant to this Agreement will also terminate. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, if Providers are not properly credentialed by BCBST within <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CPA_TermCredentialingPeriod" Title="CPA_TermCredentialingPeriod" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true" /> #>90 days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the date this Agreement is signed by the Provider, this Agreement and participation in all Networks pursuant to this Agreement will automatically terminate and become null and void.
MasterClauseData.HOS_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.HOS_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2_p2: In the event that inpatient hospice services are provided by any third-party admitting facility, hospice services must be billed by Provider and not the admitting facility. Provider is responsible for reimbursing the admitting facility.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Against_Medical_Advice_Discharges_Se: Against Medical Advice Discharges.  Inpatient Stays during which the Member left the Provider against medical advice will be reimbursable as referenced in the Inpatient Stay Payment Category Table or an Outlier payment, whichever is applicable.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Indemnification_Section_10.2_p2: The Parties acknowledge that a governmental entity, as the same is defined in the Tennessee Code Annotated Section 29-20-102, may be protected by the limitation of liability imposed by the Tennessee Governmental Tort Liability Act, as defined in Tennessee Code Annotated Section 29-20-101 et seq. The Parties also acknowledge that any non-Tennessee governmental entity may be protected by a similar limitation of liability.
MasterClauseData.HOS_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2_p1: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HOS_Billing_Requirements" Title="HOS_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>CMS 1450 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Expired_Patients_Section_3.2_c: Expired Patients.  An Inpatient Stay during which the Member expires will be treated as a normal discharge and reimbursable as referenced in the Inpatient Stay Payment Category Table or an Outlier payment, whichever is applicable.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Indemnification_Section_10.2_p1: Indemnification.  Each Party (the “Indemnitor”) agrees to indemnify and hold the other Party (the “Indemnitee”) harmless from any and all liability, loss, damage, claim, and expense of any kind, including costs and attorneys' fees which result from the negligent or willful acts or omissions of the Indemnitor, its agents or employees, regarding the duties and obligations of the Indemnitor under the Agreement, including, as applicable, the duty to maintain the legal standard of care applicable to the Indemnitor. Such indemnification and holding harmless will not apply to any matters resulting in whole or in part from the negligent or willful acts or omissions of the Indemnitee, its agents or employees. The indemnification provisions of this section shall not apply to the State of Tennessee.
MasterClauseData.HOS_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="HOS_Maximum_Allowable" Title="HOS_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>claim level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Ambulance_Services_Section_3.2_b: Ambulance Services.  Appropriate hospital-based ambulance services provided prior to an Inpatient Stay will be paid in addition to the DRG Base Rate or other applicable Payment Rate set forth in the Inpatient Payment Category Table and should be billed by the Provider as an outpatient service. Ambulance charges incurred while the patient is an inpatient are included in the DRG Base Rate regardless of whether the ambulance provider is owned/operated by Provider or an Affiliate or an independent ambulance contractor. In instances where the ambulance provider is an independent ambulance contractor, ambulance services will be considered Covered Services furnished under arrangement.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Third_Party_Acts_and_Omissions_Secti: Third Party Acts and Omissions.  Neither BCBST, Provider, nor any of their respective agents or employees will be liable to third parties for any act or omission of the other Party.
MasterClauseData.HOS_Routine_Home_Care_Section_1.4: “Routine Home Care” means hospice care provided in the Member's home while the Member is not under one of the other levels of care. This includes respite care delivered in the home and care that would otherwise have been Continuous Home Care but included less than 8 hours of nursing care in a 24-hour period.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Now_Therefore_Section_1.3: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants hereinafter contained, the Parties agree as follows:
MasterClauseData.ACA_Transfer_Payments_Section_3.2_a: Transfer Payments.  Transfers are considered normal admissions for the Receiving Hospital and are reimbursable as an Inpatient Stay in accordance with the Receiving Hospital's contract. BCBST will pay Transferring Hospital the Transfer Per Diem in accordance with the Inpatient Payment Category Table above, not to exceed the total DRG Base Rate payment inclusive of outlier, had the Transfer not occurred.
MasterClauseData.HOS_Inpatient_Respite_Care_Section_1.3: “Inpatient Respite Care” means short-term care provided in an inpatient setting to a Member receiving hospice services so that the Member's family or other persons caring for the Member can rest or take time off.  Inpatient Respite Care is limited to five (5) consecutive days per episode.
MasterClauseData.CPA_Whereas_the_Parties_Section_1.2: WHEREAS, the Parties desire to enter into this Agreement for the Provider to provide healthcare services to the Members.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Covered_Services_for_Inpatient_Secti: Outlier.  When the Length of Stay during a single Inpatient Stay exceeds the BCBST Outlier Day Threshold per DRG as indicated in Attachment 1-A$, the Payment Rate will be calculated using the following formula: DRG Base Rate + [(70% ( DRG Base Rate / ALOS)) * (ALOS – BCBST Outlier Day Threshold)]. This applies to all services in the Inpatient Payment Category Table except [Rehabilitation], [Swing Bed], [NICU] and [Obstetrics.]
MasterClauseData.CPA_Whereas_Section_1.1: WHEREAS, BCBST issues and administers benefit plans covering the provision of healthcare services to its Members (as such term is defined herein); and
MasterClauseData.HOS_General_Inpatient_Care_Section_1.2: “General Inpatient Care” means short-term inpatient hospice care for pain control or management of acute and severe clinical problems which cannot be managed in other settings.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Covered_Services_for_Inpatient_Secti: Covered Services for Inpatient.  Covered Services provided to a Member during an Inpatient Stay are payable as described in the Inpatient Payment Category Table. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, the Payment Rate for an Inpatient Stay is the Payment Rate in effect on the date the Inpatient Stay begins.
MasterClauseData.HOS_Continuous_Home_Care_Section_1.1: “Continuous Home Care” means hospice care provided for a brief period of crisis to a Member who is not in an inpatient facility and who receives hospice care consisting predominantly of nursing care on a continuous basis. Care must include eight (8) hours of nursing care in a twenty-four (24) hour period to be considered Continuous Home Care
MasterClauseData.CAU_DME_Section_3.2_p2: <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CAU_DME_Percent" Title="CAU_DME_Percent" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>75%<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> of the DMEPOS Fee Schedule. The rates in this section shall be in combination with any Member Cost Sharing Obligations due by the applicable Member to the Provider.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Escalators_Section_2.7: Escalator(s). Escalators are applied to only fixed rates. Exclusions from the escalators include Transfer per diems, outliers, rates paid at a percentage of charge, rates paid at a percentage of Medicare, or rates paid at a percentage of a fee schedule.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Audit_Section_2.6: Audit. BCBST may recover from Provider any amounts identified during an audit, pursuant to BCBSTs standard audit policy.
MasterClauseData.CAU_DME_Section_3.2_p1: DME.  Payment for DME Covered Services is:
MasterClauseData.ACA_Chargemaster_Protection_Section_2.5: Chargemaster Protection.  For those services paid at a POC, BCBST acknowledges that Provider may increase the charge values within its Chargemaster. Provider must provide BCBST with written notice of any changes to its Chargemaster <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACA_Prior_Written_Notice" Title="ACA_Prior_Written_Notice" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>sixty (60) days<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> prior to the effective date of such change(s) BCBST may, as appropriate, make adjustments to POC Payments to ensure the overall payment remains equivalent to the payments prior to the increase. BCBST will provide written notification to Provider of the adjustment to the rates paid at POC, and such adjustment will take effect in accordance with the written notification without a formal amendment to the Attachment. Without limiting any other audit rights of BCBST, BCBST has the right to audit Provider's records to assure compliance with this provision.
MasterClauseData.CAU_Chiropractic_Services_Section_3.1: Chiropractic Services. Payment for chiropractic Covered Services, excluding DME, during a single office visit is the Global Rate of <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CAU_Chiropractic_Services_Per_Visit" Title="CAU_Chiropractic_Services_Per_Visit" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>$60.00<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> per visit. Except for chiropractic Covered Services provided to FEP Members which will be paid in accordance with the attached FEP Chiropractic Rate Attachment. The Maximum Allowable for chiropractic Covered Services provided to FEP Members will be the lesser of Provider's billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate fee amount in the FEP Chiropractic Rate Attachment. All payment or fee amounts listed in the FEP Chiropractic Rate Attachment are subject to payment of lesser billed charges. "FEP Members" shall mean those individuals who receive Covered Services through the Federal Employee Health Benefit Plan. Except as otherwise provided herein, the Global Rate in this section shall be all-inclusive and shall, in combination with any Member Cost Sharing Obligations due by the applicable Member to the chiropractic Provider, compensate Provider in full for all services and supplies provided in association with Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.4: Use of Codes.  The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.CAU_Acupuncture_Section_3.1: Acupuncture. Payment for all acupuncture Covered Services furnished by Provider during a single office visit shall be reimbursed as set forth below. Except as otherwise provided herein, the reimbursement set forth below shall, in combination with any Member Cost Sharing Obligations due by the applicable Member to the Provider, compensate Provider in full for all services and supplies provided in association with acupuncture Covered Services.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3: Reimbursement Policies.  In addition to the payment policies described in this Attachment, BCBST pays claims pursuant to the reimbursement guidelines and policies contained in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CAU_Use_of_Codes_Section_2.5: Use of Codes. The codes associated with the Agreement are subject to addition, revision, and deletion by the governing agencies or authorities in accordance with the Provider Manual. If any codes associated with the Agreement are added, revised, and/or deleted, this Agreement will be interpreted to incorporate such change, without the need for formal amendment.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a CMS 1450 form or its current equivalent. Claims must comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CAU_Rate_Sources_Updates_Section_2.4_p2: The rates for chiropractic DME Covered Services described in this Attachment are based on the current Medicare Region C DMEPOS Fee Schedule for Tennessee (“DMEPOS Fee Schedule”).
MasterClauseData.ACA_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable.  The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="ACAM_Maximum_Allowable" Title="ACAM_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>claim level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.CAU_Rate_Sources_Updates_Section_2.4_p1: Rate Sources; Updates. BCBST shall only pay for chiropractic Covered Services when billed with the appropriate CPT® Codes as listed herein or described in the Provider Manual. If any CPT® Code used herein is replaced or altered by the AMA, this Attachment automatically shall incorporate such replacement or alteration, without the need for formal amendment of this Attachment or the Provider Agreement.
MasterClauseData.ACA_HCPCS_Code_Section_1.9: “HCPCS Code” means Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System based on the AMA's Current Procedural Terminology (“CPT®”) and updated by CMS.
MasterClauseData.CAU_Reimbursement_Policies_Section_2.3: Reimbursement Policies. In addition to the payment policies described herein, BCBST shall make payment of claims pursuant to the applicable payment guidelines and policies published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.CAU_Billing_Requirements_Section_2.2: Billing Requirements.  All claims related to this Attachment must be submitted on a <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CAU_Billing_Requirements" Title="CAU_Billing_Requirements" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>CMS 1500 form<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> or its current equivalent. Claims shall comply with the applicable billing guidelines published in the Provider Manual.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Geometric_Mean_Length_of_Stay_Sectio: “Geometric Mean Length of Stay” (“GMLOS”) means the GMLOS published annually by CMS for each DRG. For more information, please see the CMS website under Acute Inpatient PPS.
MasterClauseData.CAU_Maximum_Allowable_Section_2.1: Maximum Allowable. The Maximum Allowable is the lesser of billed charges for Covered Services or the appropriate payment amount in this Attachment, less any Member Cost Sharing Obligations. Maximum Allowable will be calculated at the <# <TrackedContent TrackName="CAU_Maximum_Allowable" Title="CAU_Maximum_Allowable" Hidden="true" Deletable="true" Editable="true"/> #>line level<# <EndTrackedContent/> #> as further defined in the Provider Manual. All payments are subject to lesser of billed charges.
MasterClauseData.ACA_DRG_Weight_Section_1.7: “DRG Weight” means the value of each DRG relative to the DRG Base Rate and are listed on Attachment 1-A. These weights are unique to BCBST.
MasterClauseData.CAU_HCPCS_Code_Section_1.5: “HCPCS Code” means Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System based on the AMA's Current Procedural Technology ("CPT®”) and updated by CMS.
MasterClauseData.ACA_DRG_Grouper_Section_1.6: “DRG Grouper” refers to the software purchased from a third party and used by BCBST to assign DRGs to Inpatient Stays based on clinical similarity and the expected amount of resources used. BCBST uses a DRG Grouper based on CMS's Medical Severity-Diagnosis Related Group ("MS-DRG") system.
MasterClauseData.CAU_Global_Rate_Section_1.4: “Global Rate” means the per-visit rate paid for chiropractic Covered Services. The Global Rate does not include DME Covered Services provided by Provider.
MasterClauseData.ACA_DRG_Base_Rate_Section_1.5: “DRG Base Rate” means a Payment Methodology that multiplies the DRG Base Rate by the DRG Weight to determine payment for an Inpatient Stay. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the DRG Base Rate, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member including, but not limited to, Implants, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and room and board.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Related_Group_Section_1.4: “Diagnosis-Related Group” (“DRG”) means the classification system administered by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (“CMS”) that places Inpatient Stays into medically meaningful categories, based on diagnosis, other clinical factors, and expected use of resources. DRG may also refer to the categories into which Inpatient Stays are grouped.
MasterClauseData.CAU_CPT_Code_Section_1.2: “CPT® Code” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.ACA_CPT_Code_Section_1.3: “CPT® Code(s)” means a Current Procedural Terminology Code as created by the American Medical Association (“AMA”). CPT® is a registered trademark of the AMA.
MasterClauseData.CAU_CMS_Section_1.1: “CMS” means the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Transferring_Hospital_Section_1.26: “Transferring Hospital” means the hospital that initially admits and subsequently transfers a Member to a Receiving Hospital.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Transfers_Section_1.25: “Transfer(s)” means instances in which a Member is transferred from a Transferring Hospital to a Receiving Hospital for treatment.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Surgical_Implant_Section_1.24: “Surgical Implant” means a device that is Medically Necessary that is surgically placed internally for therapeutic or reconstructive purposes and not considered a prosthetic or orthotic device.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Surgical_Appliance_Section_1.23: “Surgical Appliance” means a surgical device that is Medically Necessary that is externally placed as a part of a surgical procedure and is integral to the surgical procedure and not considered a prosthetic or orthotic device.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Short_Term_Stay_Section_1.22: “Short Term Stay” means an Inpatient Stay that is three days or less and reimbursed with the Short Term Stay Per Case payment in place of the DRG Base Rate payment.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Revenue_Codes_Section_1.21: “Revenue Code(s)” means a hospital Revenue Code as adopted by CMS.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Receiving_Hospital_Section_1.20: “Receiving Hospital” means the hospital that receives a Member from a Transferring Hospital.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Chargemaster_Section_1.2: “Chargemaster” means Provider's comprehensive listing of items and services billable by Provider and Provider's associated charges for such items and services.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Percent_of_Charge_Payments_POC_Secti: “Percent of Charge Payment(s)” (“POC”) means the percentage applied to the Provider's detail line item covered charge to determine the payment rates for those services for which the payment rate is calculated as a percentage of covered charges.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Per_Visit_Section_1.18: “Per Visit” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member on a one (1) calendar day period, for each type of service for which a Per Visit payment is indicated in this Attachment. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Visit payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member including, but not limited to, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay or an Outpatient Encounter, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and institution and ancillary services. Provider is required to identify each date of service when submitting claims that span multiple dates of service.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Per_Unit_Section_1.17: “Per Unit” means a Payment Methodology based on CPT® Code/HCPCS Code in the applicable fee schedules for each unit of service. Provider must bill the appropriate Revenue Code and CPT® Code/HCPCS Code to receive payment.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Per_Diems_Section_1.16: “Per Diem(s)” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member for each day of an Inpatient Stay. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Diem payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member during each day of an Inpatient Stay including, but not limited to, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non- diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and room and board.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Per_Case_Section_1.15: “Per Case” means a Payment Methodology applicable to services provided to a Member during an Inpatient Stay or an Outpatient Encounter. Unless otherwise specified in this Attachment, payment under the Per Case payment, less any applicable Member Cost Sharing Obligations, is payment in full for all services provided to the Member including, but not limited to, Implants, professional fees billed by the Provider on an institutional claim, services rendered by non-physician personnel, preadmission diagnostic and non-diagnostic services that occur within three calendar days prior to an Inpatient Stay or an Outpatient Encounter, nursing care, observation, critical care, surgical services, diagnostic and therapeutic services (including but not limited to diagnostic imaging), ancillary services, durable medical equipment, supplies (including but not limited to anesthesia supplies), medication, and room and board.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Payment_Rates_Section_1.14: “Payment Rate(s)” means Maximum Allowable as defined in the Billing and Reimbursement Guidelines section below.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Payment_Methodology_Section_1.13: “Payment Methodology” means a methodology for determining Payment Rates in this attachment.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Outpatient_Surgery_Group_Section_1.1: “Outpatient Surgery Group” means the group to which an outpatient surgical procedure code is assigned based on expected use of resources. This does not include any outpatient surgical procedures specifically carved out in this attachment.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Length_of_Stay_Section_1.11: “Length of Stay” (“LOS”) means the number of days in an Inpatient Stay.
MasterClauseData.ACA_Implantss_Section_1.10: “Implant(s)” means a Surgical Implant or a Surgical Appliance.
MasterClauseData.ACA_ALOS_Section_1.1: “Average Length of Stay” (“ALOS”) means the average number of days of an Inpatient Stay for each DRG, as set forth in Attachment 1-A.
